null.verse 23:78: A On je ten, jenž stvořil vám sluch, zrak i srdce - a jak málo jste mu vděčni!
null.verse 23:79: A On je ten, jenž vás po zemi rozšířil, a u Něho budete shromážděni.
null.verse 23:80: A On je ten, jenž život i smrt dává, a On střídání noci a dne ovládá.
null.verse 23:81: Ba nikoliv! Oni hovoří totéž, co již dřívější hovořili,
null.verse 23:82: a říkají: "Cožpak až zemřeme a prachem a kostmi se staneme, budeme vzkříšeni?
null.verse 23:83: Tím už dříve vyhrožováno bylo nám i otcům našim, a nejsou to leč povídačky starých!"
null.verse 23:84: Rci: "Komu náleží země a ti, kdo na ní jsou, víte-li?"
null.verse 23:85: Odvětí: "Bohu.
null.verse 23:86: Zeptej se: "Kdo Pánem je sedmi nebí a Pánem trůnu nesmírného?"
null.verse 23:87: Odvětí: "Bůh.
null.verse 23:88: Otaž se: "V čí ruce je panství nade všemi věcmi a kdo ochraňuje, zatímco proti Němu žádné ochrany není, odpovězte, víte-li?"
null.verse 23:89: Odvětí: "Bůh.
null.verse 23:90: Ba věru, My přišli jsme k nim s pravdou, zatímco oni vskutku lháři jsou.
null.verse 23:91: Bůh nevzal si žádné dítě a není vedle Něho božstva jiného, jinak by každé božstvo odneslo to, co stvořilo, a některé z nich by se nad druhé povýšilo.
null.verse 23:92: On, jenž zná nepoznatelné i všeobecně známé.
null.verse 23:93: Rci: "Pane můj, jestliže mi ukážeš to, co slíbeno bylo jim,
null.verse 23:94: pak, Pane můj, nedej, abych byl mezi lidem nespravedlivým!"
null.verse 23:95: Jsme věru s to ti ukázat, co jsme jim slíbili,
null.verse 23:96: avšak raději odrážej zlé tím, co je lepší! My dobře známe to, co si vymýšlejí.
null.verse 23:97: Rci: "Pane můj, utíkám se k Tobě před satanů našeptáváním
null.verse 23:98: a utíkám se k Tobě, Pane můj, před jejich přiblížením!"
null.verse 23:99: A když k některému z nich přichází smrt, tu volá: "Pane můj, dej mi vrátit se na zemi,
null.verse 23:100: možná že vykonám něco dobrého v tom, co jsem zanedbal!" Však pozor! Toto jsou jen slova, jež pronáší, avšak za nimi stojí přehrada až do dne, kdy budou vzkříšeni.
null.verse 23:101: A až bude zatroubeno na pozoun, v ten den mezi nimi nebude platit rodokmen a nebudou se vzájemně vyptávat.
null.verse 23:102: Ti, jejichž váha bude těžká, ti věru budou blažení,
null.verse 23:103: ale ti, jejichž váha bude lehká, ti sami sobě ztrátu způsobili a budou v pekle nesmrtelní,
null.verse 23:104: jejich tváře bude oheň ošlehávat a oni zuby budou skřípat.
null.verse 23:105: Což vám nebyla Má znamení zvěstována? Vy však jste je za lživá prohlásili!
null.verse 23:106: Řeknou: "Pane náš, přemohla nás naše nešťastná povaha a stali jsme se lidmi bloudícími.
null.verse 23:107: Pane náš, vyveď nás odsud, a jestliže to budeme na zemi opakovat, pak vskutku budeme nespravedliví.
null.verse 23:108: I řekne Bůh: "Zahnáni buďtež do něho a nemluvte na Mne!
null.verse 23:109: Vždyť věru jedna část služebníků Mých hovořila:, Pane náš, uvěřili jsme, odpusť nám a slituj se nad námi, neboť Tys nejlepší ze slitovníků!?
null.verse 23:110: A vy jste si z nich posměšky tropili, takže jste na Mé připomenutí zapomněli a ještě jste se jim smáli.
null.verse 23:111: Dnes však Já odměňuji věřící za to, co vytrpěli, a oni dnes úspěchu dosáhli.
null.verse 23:112: A pak se Bůh otáže: "Jaký počet let jste na zemi setrvali?"
null.verse 23:113: Odpovědi: "Setrvali jsme tam den či jeho část.
null.verse 23:114: I odpoví: "Setrvali jste tam pouze dobu nepatrnou, ach, kéž byste byli věděli!
null.verse 23:115: Domníváte se snad, že jsme vás stvořili jen bezúčelně a že k Nám nebudete navráceni?"
null.verse 23:116: Nechť je povznesen Bůh, vládce skutečný! Není božstva kromě Něho, Pána trůnu vznešeného!
null.verse 23:117: A kdo vzývá vedle Boha ještě božstvo jiné, o němž důkazu nemá, ten Pánu svému z toho musí vydat počet.
null.verse 23:118: A rci: "Pane můj, odpusť a slituj se, vždyť Tys nejlepší ze slitovníků!" blaženi!

null.verse 23:2: Die ootmoedig zijn in hun gebeden.
null.verse 23:3: En die al hetgeen ijdel is, schuwen.
null.verse 23:4: En die aktief zijn in het betalen van Zakaat.
null.verse 23:5: En die hun vleselijke lusten beheersen.
null.verse 23:6: Behalve met hun vrouwen of hetgeen hun rechterhand bezit, want dan treft hen geen verwijt.
null.verse 23:7: Doch degenen die deze perken te buiten gaan, zullen overtreders zijn.
null.verse 23:8: Zij die zorgzaam zijn voor het hun toevertrouwde en voor hun overeenkomsten.
null.verse 23:9: En die hun gebeden in acht nemen.
null.verse 23:11: Die het paradijs zullen erven.
null.verse 23:12: Voorwaar, Wij scheppen de mens uit een uittreksel van klei;
null.verse 23:13: Dan plaatsen Wij hem als een kleine levenskiem in een veilige plaats.
null.verse 23:14: Vervolgens vormen Wij de levenskiem tot een klonter bloed; daarna vormen Wij het geronnen bloed tot een (vormeloze) klomp; dan vormen Wij beenderen uit deze (vormeloze) klomp; daarna bekleden Wij deze beenderen met vlees; vervolgens ontwikkelen Wij het tot een nieuwe schepping.
null.verse 23:15: Voorzeker daarna sterf je.
null.verse 23:16: En op de Dag der Verrijzenis zul je worden opgewekt.
null.verse 23:17: En boven u hebben Wij zeven wegen gemaakt, en nimmer veronachtzamen Wij de schepping.
null.verse 23:18: Wij zenden water uit de hemel neer in bepaalde hoeveelheid en Wij doen deze in de aarde blijven en voorzeker zijn Wij ook in staat die weer weg te nemen.
null.verse 23:19: En Wij brengen daarmede tuinen van dadelpalmen en wijnstokken voor u voort, waarvan je overvloedig fruit hebt; en je eet daarvan.
null.verse 23:20: En Wij brengen een boom voort die groeit uit de berg Sinaï: deze brengt olie en een saus voort voor hen die het willen nuttigen.
null.verse 23:21: En in het vee is eveneens een les voor u.
null.verse 23:22: Daarop zowel als op schepen word je gedragen.
null.verse 23:23: En Wij zonden Noach tot zijn volk, en hij zeide: "O mijn volk, dien God.
null.verse 23:24: En de hoofden van zijn volk, die ongelovig waren, zeiden: "Hij is slechts een mens zoals gij, hij zou zich boven u willen verheffen.
null.verse 23:25: Hij is slechts een bezetene; wacht daarom een korte wijle, (ongetwijfeld zal hem iets overkomen).
null.verse 23:26: Noach zeide: "O mijn Heer, help mij, want zij hebben mij verloochend.
null.verse 23:27: Toen openbaarden Wij hem: "Bouw de Ark onder Onze ogen en in overeenstemming met Onze openbaring.
null.verse 23:28: "En wanneer je de Ark zult hebben betrokken - jij en degenen die met u zijn, zeg dan: "Alle lof behoort aan God, Die ons van een boosaardig volk heeft gered.
null.verse 23:29: En zeg: "Mijn Heer, verleen mij een gezegende landing, want Gij zijt de Beste Landingshulp.
null.verse 23:30: Voorwaar, hierin zijn tekenen, en waarlijk Wij stellen (de mensen) op de proef.
null.verse 23:31: Toen verwekten Wij een ander geslacht na hen.
null.verse 23:32: En Wij zonden onder hen een boodschapper uit hun midden, die zeide: "Dient God, je hebt geen andere God dan Hem.
null.verse 23:33: En de hoofden van zijn volk, die ongelovig waren en die de ontmoeting in het Hiernamaals loochenden en wie Wij in dit leven overvloed (van het goede der aarde) hadden gegeven, zeiden: "Dit is slechts een mens, zoals gij.
null.verse 23:34: En indien je een man gelijk aan uzelf gehoorzaamt dan ben je zeker verloren.
null.verse 23:35: Belooft hij u dat wanneer je dood en stof en beenderen bent geworden, jij weer zult worden opgewekt?
null.verse 23:36: Verre, verre is hetgeen u wordt beloofd!
null.verse 23:37: Er is geen ander leven buiten ons tegenwoordige leven; wij leven en sterven en zullen niet worden opgewekt.
null.verse 23:38: Hij is niet anders dan een mens die een leugen heeft verzonnen over God; wij zullen in hem stellig niet geloven.
null.verse 23:39: Hij zeide: "Mijn Heer, help mij, want zij hebben mij verloochend.
null.verse 23:40: (God) zeide: "Binnen korte tijd zullen zij zeker spijt krijgen.
null.verse 23:41: Terecht greep hen daarom de rukwind en Wij maakten hen als wrakhout.
null.verse 23:42: Toen verwekten Wij na hen andere geslachten.
null.verse 23:43: Geen volk kan zijn vastgestelde tijd overschrijden, evenmin kunnen zij die uitstellen.
null.verse 23:44: Dan zonden Wij Onze boodschappers de een na de ander.
null.verse 23:45: Dan zonden Wij Mozes en zijn broeder Aäron met Onze tekenen en een duidelijk gezag
null.verse 23:46: Tot Pharao en zijn opperhoofden; zij toonden hoogmoed en waren een aanmatigend volk.
null.verse 23:47: En zij zeiden: "Moeten wij geloven in twee mannen aan ons gelijk terwigl hun volk onze slaaf is?"
null.verse 23:48: Derhalve verloochenden zij hen en zij behoorden tot degenen die vernietigd werden.
null.verse 23:49: En wij schonken Mozes het Boek opdat zij (de kinderen Israëls) leiding mochten volge.
null.verse 23:50: En Wij bestemden de zoon van Maria en zijn moeder tot een teken en schonken hun toevlucht op een hoog plateau met groene weiden en bronnen.
null.verse 23:51: O gij boodschappers, eet van hetgeen rein is en verricht goede werken.
null.verse 23:52: En weet dat uw gemeenschap één gemeenschap is en dat Ik uw Heer ben.
null.verse 23:53: Maar zij hebben hun godsdienst onder elkander verdeeld, elke partij verheugt zich over hetgeen zij bezit.
null.verse 23:54: Laat hen daarom voor een tijd aan hun onwetendheid over.
null.verse 23:55: Denken zij dat vanwege de rijkdom en de zonen waarmee Wij hen helpen,
null.verse 23:56: Wij Ons haasten hun goed te doen? Neen, zij begrijpen het niet.
null.verse 23:57: Voorwaar, degenen die sidderen van ontzag voor hun Heer,
null.verse 23:58: En degenen die geloven in de tekenen van hun Heer,
null.verse 23:59: En degenen die hun Heer geen deelgenoten toeschrijven,
null.verse 23:60: En degenen die weggeven hetgeen zij (kunnen) geven terwijl hun hart is vervuld van vrees.
null.verse 23:61: Dezen zijn het die zich haasten en wedijveren in het doen van goede werken.
null.verse 23:62: Wij belasten geen ziel boven haar vermogen.
null.verse 23:63: Maar hun hart is onverschillig jegens dit Boek, en buitendien hebben zij bezigheden waarmee zij voortgaan;
null.verse 23:64: Totdat, wanneer Wij degenen hunner die in weelde leven met straf grijpen, ziet, dan jammeren zij allen om hulp.
null.verse 23:65: Klaag niet op deze Dag, want je zult door Ons niet worden geholpen.
null.verse 23:66: Mijn woorden werden u verkondigd, doch gij placht u af te keren.
null.verse 23:67: Hovaardig, in dwaasheid er over pratende.
null.verse 23:68: Hebben zij dan niet over het Woord nagedacht, of is er iets tot hen gekomen dat niet tot hun voorvaderen kwam?
null.verse 23:69: Of hebben zij hun boodschapper niet erkend dat zij hem niet aanvaarden?
null.verse 23:70: Of zeggen zij: "Hij is krankzinng?" Neen, hij heeft hun de Waarheid gebracht maar de meesten hunner houden niet van de Waarheid.
null.verse 23:71: En indien de Waarheid hun wensen had gevolgd, voorwaar dan zouden de hemelen en de aarde en al hetgeen daarin is, in wanorde zijn geraakt.
null.verse 23:72: Of vraag je van hen enige beloning? Doch de beloning van uw Heer is beter en Hij is de beste Voorziener.
null.verse 23:73: En je roept hen, voorzeker, tot het rechte pad;
null.verse 23:74: Maar degenen, die in het Hiernamaals niet geloven dwalen inderdaad van dit pad af.
null.verse 23:75: En indien Wij ons over hen ontfermden en hun kwaal verlichtten, zouden zij toch blindelings in hun overtreding volharden.
null.verse 23:76: Wij troffen hen door een straf, doch zij werden niet nederig voor hun Heer noch werden zij ootmoedig.
null.verse 23:77: Maar, wanneer Wij voor hen de poort der gestrenge straf openen, dan zullen zij tot wanhoop vervallen.
null.verse 23:78: (God) is het, Die oren, en ogen en hart voor u heeft geschapen, doch je betoont weinig dank.
null.verse 23:79: En Hij is het, Die u heeft vermenigvuldigd op aarde en tot Hem zul je worden verzameld.
null.verse 23:80: En Hij is het, Die leven schenkt en de dood veroorzaakt en in Zijn handen is de wisseling van nacht en dag.
null.verse 23:81: Doch zij zeggen hetzelfde als de voormalige volkeren zeiden.
null.verse 23:82: Zij zeggen: "Zullen wij, wanneer wij dood zijn en tot beenderen en stof geworden, dan inderdaad weer worden opgewekt?
null.verse 23:83: "Dit werd ons en onze voorvaderen ook beloofd maar het zijn slechts fabelen der ouden.
null.verse 23:84: eg: "Wie behoort de aarde toe en al hetgeen daarop is, als je het weet?"
null.verse 23:85: Zij zullen zeggen: "Aan God.
null.verse 23:86: Zeg: "Wie is de Heer der zeven hemelen en de Heer van de Grote Troon?"
null.verse 23:87: Zij zullen zeggen: "God.
null.verse 23:88: Zeg: "Wie is het in Wiens hand de heerschappij over alle dingen is - en Die beschermt doch tegen Wie er geen bescherming is, - als je het weet?"
null.verse 23:89: Zij zullen antwoorden: "Dit behoort aan God.
null.verse 23:90: Wij hebben hun de Waarheid gebracht en zij zijn zeker leugenaars.
null.verse 23:91: God heeft zich geen zoon genomen, noch is er enige God naast Hem, anders zou elke God hetgeen Hij schiep, voor zich houden, en sommigen hunner zouden zeker anderen hebben overwonnen.
null.verse 23:92: Kenner van het ongeziene en het geziene.
null.verse 23:93: Zeg: "Mijn Heer, indien Gij mij datgene zoudt laten zien waarmee zij bedreigd worden.
null.verse 23:94: Mijn Heer, plaats mij dan niet te midden van het onrechtvaardige volk.
null.verse 23:95: En voorzeker, Wij hebben de macht u datgene te laten zien waarmee Wij hen bedreigen.
null.verse 23:96: Verdrijf het kwade met het beste.
null.verse 23:97: En zeg: "Mijn Heer, bij U zoek ik mijn toevlucht tegen de inblazingen der duivelen.
null.verse 23:98: En bij U mijn Heer zoek ik mijn toevlucht, opdat zij niet bij mij komen.
null.verse 23:99: Wanneer de dood tot een hunner komt, zegt deze smekend: "Mijn Heer, zend mij terug.
null.verse 23:100: Opdat ik recht doe in hetgeen ik heb achtergelaten.
null.verse 23:101: En wanneer de bazuin wordt geblazen zal er die Dag geen verwantschap tussen hen bestaan, noch zal de een naar de ander vragen.
null.verse 23:102: Dan zullen zij slagen, wier schalen zwaar zijn.
null.verse 23:103: Doch zij, wier werken licht zijn - dit zijn degenen die hun ziel benadeelden - zullen in de hel vertoeven.
null.verse 23:104: Het Vuur zal hun gezicht branden en zij zullen er in verschrompelen.
null.verse 23:105: (Er zal gezegd worden): Werden Mijn woorden U niet verkondigd? Maar je placht ze te verloochenen.
null.verse 23:106: Zij zullen antwoorden: "O, onze Heer onze tegenspoed heeft ons overweldigd en wij waren een dwalend volk.
null.verse 23:107: Onze Heer, neem ons daaruit; indien wij in het (kwade) terugvallen dan zijn wij stellig onrechtvaardig.
null.verse 23:108: Hij zal zeggen: "Blijft daarin vernederd en spreekt niet tot Mij.
null.verse 23:109: Waarlijk, er was een gedeelte van Mijn dienaren dat placht te zeggen: "O, onze Heer, wij hebben geloofd, vergeef ons daarom en wees Barmhartig jegens ons.
null.verse 23:110: Maar je maakte hen ten spot totdat dezen u Mijn gedachtenis deden vergeten omdat je hen placht uit te lachen.
null.verse 23:111: Inderdaad heb Ik hen heden beloond wegens hun geduld.
null.verse 23:112: Hij (God) zal vragen: "Hoeveel jaren ben je op de aarde gebleven?"
null.verse 23:113: Zij zullen antwoorden: "Wij bleven een dag of een deel van een dag.
null.verse 23:114: Hij (God) zal zeggen: "Je bleeft een korte tijd, had je het maar geweten.
null.verse 23:115: Dacht je, dat Wij u tevergeefs schiepen en dat je niet tot Ons zult worden teruggebracht?
null.verse 23:116: Verheven is God, de ware Koning.
null.verse 23:117: En diegene die naast God een andere god aanroept heeft daar geen bewijs voor: en de vergelding ervan berust bij zijn Heer.
null.verse 23:118: En zeg: "O mijn Heer, vergeef en wees Barmhartig, want Gij zijt de Barmhartigste der barmhartigen.

Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:2: Who are humble in their prayers,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:4: And who are payers of the poor-due;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:6: Save from their wives or the (slaves) that their right hands possess, for then they are not blameworthy,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:7: But whoso craveth beyond that, such are transgressors -
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:8: And who are shepherds of their pledge and their covenant,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:9: And who pay heed to their prayers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:12: Verily We created man from a product of wet earth;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:13: Then placed him as a drop (of seed) in a safe lodging;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:14: Then fashioned We the drop a clot, then fashioned We the clot a little lump, then fashioned We the little lump bones, then clothed the bones with flesh, and then produced it as another creation.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:15: Then lo! after that ye surely die.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:16: Then lo! on the Day of Resurrection ye are raised (again).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:17: And We have created above you seven paths, and We are never unmindful of creation.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:18: And we send down from the sky water in measure, and We give it lodging in the earth, and lo! We are Able to withdraw it.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:19: Then We produce for you therewith gardens of date-palms and grapes, wherein is much fruit for you and whereof ye eat;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:20: And a tree that springeth forth from Mount Sinai that groweth oil and relish for the eaters.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:21: And lo! in the cattle there is verily a lesson for you.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:22: And on them and on the ship ye are carried.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:23: And We verily sent Noah unto his folk, and he said: O my people! Serve Allah.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:24: But the chieftains of his folk, who disbelieved, said: This is only a mortal like you who would make himself superior to you.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:25: He is only a man in whom is a madness, so watch him for a while.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:26: He said: My Lord! Help me because they deny me.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:27: Then We inspired in him, saying: Make the ship under Our eyes and Our inspiration.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:28: And when thou art on board the ship, thou and whoso is with thee, then say: Praise be to Allah Who hath saved us from the wrongdoing folk!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:29: And say: My Lord! Cause me to land at a blessed landing-place, for Thou art Best of all who bring to land.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:30: Lo! herein verily are portents, for lo! We are ever putting (mankind) to the test.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:31: Then, after them, We brought forth another generation;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:32: And we sent among them a messenger of their own, saying: Serve Allah, Ye have no other God save Him.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:33: And the chieftains of his folk, who disbelieved and denied the meeting of the Hereafter, and whom We had made soft in the life of the world, said: This is only a mortal like you, who eateth of that whereof ye eat and drinketh of that ye drink.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:34: If ye were to obey a mortal like yourselves, then, lo! ye surely would be losers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:35: Doth he promise you that you, when ye are dead and have become dust and bones, will (again) be brought forth ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:36: Begone, begone, with that which ye are promised!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:37: There is naught but our life of the world; we die and we live, and we shall not be raised (again).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:38: He is only a man who hath invented a lie about Allah.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:39: He said: My Lord! Help me because they deny me.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:40: He said: In a little while they surely will become repentant.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:41: So the (Awful) Cry overtook them rightfully, and We made them like as wreckage (that a torrent hurleth).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:42: Then after them We brought forth other generations.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:43: No nation can outstrip its term, nor yet postpone it.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:44: Then We sent our messengers one after another.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:45: Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron with Our tokens and a clear warrant
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:46: Unto Pharaoh and his chiefs, but they scorned (them) and they were despotic folk.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:47: And they said: Shall we put faith in two mortals like ourselves, and whose folk are servile unto us ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:48: So they denied them, and became of those who were destroyed.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:49: And We verily gave Moses the Scripture, that haply they might go aright.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:50: And We made the son of Mary and his mother a portent, and We gave them refuge on a height, a place of flocks and watersprings.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:51: O ye messengers! Eat of the good things, and do right.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:52: And lo! this your religion is one religion and I am your Lord, so keep your duty unto Me.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:53: But they (mankind) have broken their religion among them into sects, each group rejoicing in its tenets.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:54: So leave them in their error till a time.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:55: Think they that in the wealth and sons wherewith We provide them
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:56: We hasten unto them with good things ? Nay, but they perceive not.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:57: Lo! those who go in awe for fear of their Lord.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:58: And those who believe in the revelations of their Lord,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:59: And those who ascribe not partners unto their Lord,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:60: And those who give that which they give with hearts afraid because they are about to return unto their Lord,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:61: These race for the good things, and they shall win them in the race.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:62: And we task not any soul beyond its scope, and with Us is a Record which speaketh the truth, and they will not be wronged.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:63: Nay, but their hearts are in ignorance of this (Qur’an), and they have other works, besides, which they are doing;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:64: Till when We grasp their luxurious ones with the punishment, behold! they supplicate.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:65: Supplicate not this day! Assuredly ye will not be helped by Us.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:66: My revelations were recited unto you, but ye used to turn back on your heels,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:68: Have they not pondered the Word, or hath that come unto them which came not unto their fathers of old ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:69: Or know they not their messenger, and so reject him ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:70: Or say they: There is a madness in him ? Nay, but he bringeth them the Truth; and most of them are haters of the Truth.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:71: And if the Truth had followed their desires, verily the heavens and the earth and whosoever is therein had been corrupted.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:72: Or dost thou ask of them (O Muhammad) any tribute ? But the bounty of thy Lord is better, for He is Best of all who make provision.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:73: And lo! thou summonest them indeed unto a straight path.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:74: And lo! those who believe not in the Hereafter are indeed astray from the path.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:75: Though We had mercy on them and relieved them of the harm afflicting them, they still would wander blindly on in their contumacy.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:76: Already have We grasped them with punishment, but they humble not themselves unto their Lord, nor do they pray,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:77: Until, when We open for them the gate of extreme punishment, behold! they are aghast thereat.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:78: He it is Who hath created for you ears and eyes and hearts.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:79: And He it is Who hath sown you broadcast in the earth, and unto Him ye will be gathered.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:80: And He it is Who giveth life and causeth death, and His is the difference of night and day.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:81: Nay, but they say the like of that which said the men of old;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:82: They say: When we are dead and have become (mere) dust and bones, shall we then, forsooth, be raised again ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:83: We were already promised this, we and our forefathers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:84: Say: Unto Whom (belongeth) the earth and whosoever is therein, if ye have knowledge ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:86: Say: Who is Lord of the seven heavens, and Lord of the Tremendous Throne ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:87: They will say: Unto Allah (all that belongeth).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:88: Say: In Whose hand is the dominion over all things and He protecteth, while against Him there is no protection, if ye have knowledge ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:89: They will say: Unto Allah (all that belongeth).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:90: Nay, but We have brought them the Truth, and lo! they are liars.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:91: Allah hath not chosen any son, nor is there any god along with Him; else would each god have assuredly championed that which he created, and some of them would assuredly have overcome others.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:92: Knower of the Invisible and the Visible! and Exalted be He over all that they ascribe as partners (unto Him)!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:93: Say: My Lord! If Thou shouldst show me that which they are promised.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:94: My Lord! then set me not among the wrongdoing folk.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:95: And verily We are Able to show thee that which We have promised them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:96: Repel evil with that which is better.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:97: And say: My Lord! I seek refuge in Thee from suggestions of the evil ones,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:98: And I seek refuge in Thee, my Lord, lest they be present with me,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:99: Until, when death cometh unto one of them, he saith: My Lord! Send me back,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:100: That I may do right in that which I have left behind! But nay! It is but a word that he speaketh; and behind them is a barrier until the day when they are raised.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:101: And when the trumpet is blown there will be no kinship among them that day, nor will they ask of one another.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:102: Then those whose scales are heavy, they are the successful.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:103: And those whose scales are light are those who lose their souls, in hell abiding.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:104: The fire burneth their faces, and they are glum therein.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:105: (It will be said): Were not My revelations recited unto you, and then ye used to deny them ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:106: They will say: Our Lord! Our evil fortune conquered us, and we were erring folk.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:107: Our Lord! Oh, bring us forth from hence! If we return (to evil) then indeed we shall be wrong-doers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:108: He saith: Begone therein, and speak not unto Me.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:109: Lo! there was a party of My slaves who said: Our Lord! We believe, therefor forgive us and have mercy on us for Thou art Best of all who show mercy;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:110: But ye chose them for a laughing-stock until they caused you to forget remembrance of Me, while ye laughed at them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:111: Lo! I have rewarded them this day forasmuch as they were steadfast in that they, even they, are the triumphant.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:112: He will say: How long tarried ye in the earth, counting by years ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:113: They will say: We tarried by a day or part of a day.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:114: He will say: Ye tarried but a little if ye only knew.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:115: Deemed ye then that We had created you for naught, and that ye would not be returned unto Us ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:116: Now Allah be Exalted, the True King! There is no God save Him, the Lord of the Throne of Grace.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:117: He who crieth unto any other god along with Allah hath no proof thereof.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 23:118: And (O Muhammad) say: My Lord! Forgive and have mercy, for Thou art Best of all who show mercy.

Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:2: Those who humble themselves in their prayers;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:4: Who are active in deeds of charity;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:6: Except with those joined to them in the marriage bond, or (the captives) whom their right hands possess,- for (in their case) they are free from blame,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:7: But those whose desires exceed those limits are transgressors;-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:8: Those who faithfully observe their trusts and their covenants;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:11: Who will inherit Paradise: they will dwell therein (for ever).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:12: Man We did create from a quintessence (of clay);
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:13: Then We placed him as (a drop of) sperm in a place of rest, firmly fixed;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:14: Then We made the sperm into a clot of congealed blood; then of that clot We made a (foetus) lump; then we made out of that lump bones and clothed the bones with flesh; then we developed out of it another creature.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:15: After that, at length ye will die
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:16: Again, on the Day of Judgment, will ye be raised up.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:17: And We have made, above you, seven tracts; and We are never unmindful of (our) Creation.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:18: And We send down water from the sky according to (due) measure, and We cause it to soak in the soil; and We certainly are able to drain it off (with ease).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:19: With it We grow for you gardens of date-palms and vines: in them have ye abundant fruits: and of them ye eat (and have enjoyment),-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:20: Also a tree springing out of Mount Sinai, which produces oil, and relish for those who use it for food.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:21: And in cattle (too) ye have an instructive example: from within their bodies We produce (milk) for you to drink; there are, in them, (besides), numerous (other) benefits for you; and of their (meat) ye eat;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:22: And on them, as well as in ships, ye ride.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:23: (Further, We sent a long line of prophets for your instruction).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:24: The chiefs of the Unbelievers among his people said: "He is no more than a man like yourselves: his wish is to assert his superiority over you: if God had wished (to send messengers), He could have sent down angels; never did we hear such a thing (as he says), among our ancestors of old.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:25: (And some said): "He is only a man possessed: wait (and have patience) with him for a time.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:26: (Noah) said: "O my Lord! help me: for that they accuse me of falsehood!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:27: So We inspired him (with this message): "Construct the Ark within Our sight and under Our guidance: then when comes Our Command, and the fountains of the earth gush forth, take thou on board pairs of every species, male and female, and thy family- except those of them against whom the Word has already gone forth: And address Me not in favour of the wrong-doers; for they shall be drowned (in the Flood).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:28: And when thou hast embarked on the Ark - thou and those with thee,- say: "Praise be to God, Who has saved us from the people who do wrong.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:29: And say: "O my Lord! enable me to disembark with thy blessing: for Thou art the Best to enable (us) to disembark.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:30: Verily in this there are Signs (for men to understand); (thus) do We try (men).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:31: Then We raised after them another generation.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:32: And We sent to them an apostle from among themselves, (saying), "Worship God! ye have no other god but Him.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:33: And the chiefs of his people, who disbelieved and denied the Meeting in the Hereafter, and on whom We had bestowed the good things of this life, said: "He is no more than a man like yourselves: he eats of that of which ye eat, and drinks of what ye drink.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:34: "If ye obey a man like yourselves, behold, it is certain ye will be lost.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:35: "Does he promise that when ye die and become dust and bones, ye shall be brought forth (again)?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:36: "Far, very far is that which ye are promised!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:37: "There is nothing but our life in this world! We shall die and we live! But we shall never be raised up again!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:38: "He is only a man who invents a lie against God, but we are not the ones to believe in him!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:39: (The prophet) said: "O my Lord! help me: for that they accuse me of falsehood.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:40: (God) said: "In but a little while, they are sure to be sorry!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:41: Then the Blast overtook them with justice, and We made them as rubbish of dead leaves (floating on the stream of Time)! So away with the people who do wrong!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:42: Then We raised after them other generations.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:43: No people can hasten their term, nor can they delay (it).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:44: Then sent We our apostles in succession: every time there came to a people their apostle, they accused him of falsehood: so We made them follow each other (in punishment): We made them as a tale (that is told): So away with a people that will not believe!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:45: Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron, with Our Signs and authority manifest,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:46: To Pharaoh and his Chiefs: But these behaved insolently: they were an arrogant people.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:47: They said: "Shall we believe in two men like ourselves? And their people are subject to us!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:48: So they accused them of falsehood, and they became of those who were destroyed.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:49: And We gave Moses the Book, in order that they might receive guidance.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:50: And We made the son of Mary and his mother as a Sign: We gave them both shelter on high ground, affording rest and security and furnished with springs.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:51: O ye apostles! enjoy (all) things good and pure, and work righteousness: for I am well-acquainted with (all) that ye do.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:52: And verily this Brotherhood of yours is a single Brotherhood, and I am your Lord and Cherisher: therefore fear Me (and no other).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:53: But people have cut off their affair (of unity), between them, into sects: each party rejoices in that which is with itself.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:54: But leave them in their confused ignorance for a time.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:55: Do they think that because We have granted them abundance of wealth and sons,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:56: We would hasten them on in every good? Nay, they do not understand.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:57: Verily those who live in awe for fear of their Lord;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:58: Those who believe in the Signs of their Lord;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:59: Those who join not (in worship) partners with their Lord;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:60: And those who dispense their charity with their hearts full of fear, because they will return to their Lord;-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:61: It is these who hasten in every good work, and these who are foremost in them.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:62: On no soul do We place a burden greater than it can bear: before Us is a record which clearly shows the truth: they will never be wronged.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:63: But their hearts are in confused ignorance of this; and there are, besides that, deeds of theirs, which they will (continue) to do,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:64: Until, when We seize in Punishment those of them who received the good things of this world, behold, they will groan in supplication!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:65: (It will be said): "Groan not in supplication this day: for ye shall certainly not be helped by Us.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:66: "My Signs used to be rehearsed to you, but ye used to turn back on your heels-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:67: "In arrogance: talking nonsense about the (Qur’an), like one telling fables by night.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:68: Do they not ponder over the Word (of God), or has anything (new) come to them that did not come to their fathers of old?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:69: Or do they not recognise their Apostle, that they deny him?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:70: Or do they say, "He is possessed"? Nay, he has brought them the Truth, but most of them hate the Truth.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:71: If the Truth had been in accord with their desires, truly the heavens and the earth, and all beings therein would have been in confusion and corruption! Nay, We have sent them their admonition, but they turn away from their admonition.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:72: Or is it that thou askest them for some recompense? But the recompense of thy Lord is best: He is the Best of those who give sustenance.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:73: But verily thou callest them to the Straight Way;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:74: And verily those who believe not in the Hereafter are deviating from that Way.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:75: If We had mercy on them and removed the distress which is on them, they would obstinately persist in their transgression, wandering in distraction to and fro.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:76: We inflicted Punishment on them, but they humbled not themselves to their Lord, nor do they submissively entreat (Him)!-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:77: Until We open on them a gate leading to a severe Punishment: then Lo! they will be plunged in despair therein!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:78: It is He Who has created for you (the faculties of) hearing, sight, feeling and understanding: little thanks it is ye give!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:79: And He has multiplied you through the earth, and to Him shall ye be gathered back.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:80: It is He Who gives life and death, and to Him (is due) the alternation of Night and Day: will ye not then understand?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:81: On the contrary they say things similar to what the ancients said.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:82: They say: "What! when we die and become dust and bones, could we really be raised up again?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:83: "Such things have been promised to us and to our fathers before! they are nothing but tales of the ancients!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:84: Say: "To whom belong the earth and all beings therein? (say) if ye know!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:85: They will say, "To God!" say: "Yet will ye not receive admonition?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:86: Say: "Who is the Lord of the seven heavens, and the Lord of the Throne (of Glory) Supreme?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:87: They will say, "(They belong) to God.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:88: Say: "Who is it in whose hands is the governance of all things,- who protects (all), but is not protected (of any)? (say) if ye know.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:89: They will say, "(It belongs) to God.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:90: We have sent them the Truth: but they indeed practise falsehood!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:91: No son did God beget, nor is there any god along with Him: (if there were many gods), behold, each god would have taken away what he had created, and some would have lorded it over others! Glory to God! (He is free) from the (sort of) things they attribute to Him!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:92: He knows what is hidden and what is open: too high is He for the partners they attribute to Him!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:93: Say: "O my Lord! if Thou wilt show me (in my lifetime) that which they are warned against,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:94: "Then, O my Lord! put me not amongst the people who do wrong!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:95: And We are certainly able to show thee (in fulfilment) that against which they are warned.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:96: Repel evil with that which is best: We are well acquainted with the things they say.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:97: And say "O my Lord! I seek refuge with Thee from the suggestions of the Evil Ones.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:98: "And I seek refuge with Thee O my Lord! lest they should come near me.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:99: (In Falsehood will they be) Until, when death comes to one of them, he says: "O my Lord! send me back (to life),-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:100: "In order that I may work righteousness in the things I neglected.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:101: Then when the Trumpet is blown, there will be no more relationships between them that Day, nor will one ask after another!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:102: Then those whose balance (of good deeds) is heavy,- they will attain salvation:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:103: But those whose balance is light, will be those who have lost their souls, in Hell will they abide.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:104: The Fire will burn their faces, and they will therein grin, with their lips displaced.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:105: "Were not My Signs rehearsed to you, and ye did but treat them as falsehood?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:106: They will say: "our Lord! Our misfortune overwhelmed us, and we became a people astray!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:107: "Our Lord! bring us out of this: if ever we return (to Evil), then shall we be wrong-doers indeed!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:108: He will say: "Be ye driven into it (with ignominy)! And speak ye not to Me!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:109: "A part of My servants there was, who used to pray ’our Lord! we believe; then do Thou forgive us, and have mercy upon us: For Thou art the Best of those who show mercy!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:110: "But ye treated them with ridicule, so much so that (ridicule of) them made you forget My Message while ye were laughing at them!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:111: "I have rewarded them this Day for their patience and constancy: they are indeed the ones that have achieved Bliss.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:112: He will say: "What number of years did ye stay on earth?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:113: They will say: "We stayed a day or part of a day: but ask those who keep account.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:114: He will say: "Ye stayed not but a little,- if ye had only known!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:115: "Did ye then think that We had created you in jest, and that ye would not be brought back to Us (for account)?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:116: Therefore exalted be God, the King, the Reality: there is no god but He, the Lord of the Throne of Honour!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:117: If anyone invokes, besides God, Any other god, he has no authority therefor; and his reckoning will be only with his Lord! and verily the Unbelievers will fail to win through!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 23:118: So say: "O my Lord! grant Thou forgiveness and mercy for Thou art the Best of those who show mercy!"

Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:2: who in their prayers are humble
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:3: and from idle talk turn away
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:6: save from their wives and what their right hands own then being not blameworthy
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:7: but whosoever seeks after more than that, those are the transgressors)
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:8: and who preserve their trusts and their covenant
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:11: who shall inherit Paradise therein dwelling forever.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:12: We created man of an extraction of clay,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:13: then We set him, a drop, in a receptacle secure,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:14: then We created of the drop a clot then We created of the clot a tissue then We created of the tissue bones then We garmented the bones in flesh; thereafter We produced him as another creature.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:15: Then after that you shall surely die,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:16: then on the Day of Resurrection you shall surely be raised up.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:17: And We created above you seven ways, and We were not heedless of creation.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:18: And We sent down out of heaven water in measure and lodged it in the earth; and We are able to take it away.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:19: Then We produced for you therewith gardens of palms and vines wherein are many fruits for you, and of them you eat,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:20: and a tree issuing from the Mount of Sinai that bears oil and seasoning for all to eat.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:21: And surely in the cattle there is a lesson for you; We give you to drink of what is in their bellies, and many uses there are in them for you, and of them you eat;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:22: and upon them, and on the ships, you are borne.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:23: And We sent Noah to his people; and he, said, ’O my people, serve God! You have no god other than He.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:24: Said the Council of the unbelievers of his people, ’This is naught but a mortal like yourselves, who desires to gain superiority over you.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:25: He is naught but a man bedevilled; so wait on him for a time.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:26: He said, ’O my Lord, help me, for that they cry me lies.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:27: Then We said to him, ’Make thou the Ark under Our eyes and as We reveal, and then, when Our command comes and the Oven boils, insert in it two of every kind and thy, family -- except for him against whom the word already has been spoken; and address Me not concerning those who have done evil; they shall be drowned.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:28: Then, when thou art seated in the Ark and those with thee, say, "Praise belongs to God, who has delivered us from the people of the evildoers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:29: And say, "’O my Lord, do Thou harbour me in a blessed harbour, for Thou art the best of harbourers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:30: Surely in that are signs, and surely We put to the test.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:31: Thereafter, after them, We produced another generation,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:32: and We sent amongst them a Messenger of themselves, saying, ’Serve God! You have no god other than He.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:33: Said the Council of the unbelievers of his people, who cried lies to the encounter of the world to come, and to whom We had given ease in the present’ life, ’This is naught but a mortal like yourselves, who eats of what you eat and drinks of what you drink.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:34: If you obey a mortal like yourselves, then you will be losers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:35: What, does he promise you that when you are dead, and become dust and bones, you shall be brought forth?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:36: Away, away with that you are promised!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:37: There is nothing but our present life; we die, and we live, and we shall not be raised up.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:38: He is naught but a man who has forged against God a lie, and we will not believe him.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:39: He said, ’O my Lord, help me, for that they cry me lies.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:40: He said, ’In a little they will be remorseful.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:41: And the Cry seized them justly, and We made them as scum; so away with the people of the evildoers!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:42: Thereafter, after them, We produced other generations;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:43: no nation outstrips its term, nor do they put it back.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:44: Then sent We Our Messengers successively; whenever its Messenger came to a nation they cried him lies, so We caused some of them to follow others, and We made them as but tales; so away with a people who do not believe!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:45: Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron with Our signs and a manifest authority
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:46: unto Pharaoh and his Council; but they waxed proud, and they were a lofty people,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:47: and they said, ’What, shall we believe two mortals like ourselves, whose people are our servants?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:48: So they cried them lies, and they were among the destroyed.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:49: And We gave Moses the Book, that haply they would be guided;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:50: and We made Mary’s son, and his mother, to be a sign, and gave them refuge upon a height, where was a hollow and a spring:
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:51: ’O Messengers, eat of the good things and do righteousness; surely I know the things you do.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:52: Surely this community of yours is one community, and I am your Lord; so fear Me.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:53: But they split in their affair between them into sects, each party rejoicing in what is with them.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:54: So leave thou them in their perplexity for a time.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:55: What, do they think that We succour them with of wealth and children,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:56: We vie in good works for them? Nay, but they are not aware.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:57: Surely those who tremble in fear of their Lord
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:58: and those who believe in the signs of their Lord
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:59: and those who associate naught with their Lord
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:60: and those who give what they give, their hearts quaking that they are returning to their Lord --
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:61: those vie in good works, outracing to them.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:62: We charge not any soul save to its capacity, and with Us is a Book speaking truth, and they shall not be wronged.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:63: Nay, but their hearts are in perplexity as to this, and they have deeds besides that that they are doing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:64: Till, when We seize with the chastisement the ones of them that live at ease, behold, they groan.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:65: ’Groan not today; surely you shall not be helped from Us.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:66: My signs were recited to you, but upon your heels you withdrew,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:67: waxing proud against it, talking foolish talk by night.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:68: Have they not pondered the saying, or came there upon them that which came not upon their fathers, the ancients?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:69: Or did they not recognise their Messenger and so denied him?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:70: Or do they say, ’He is bedevilled’? Nay, he has brought them the truth, but most of them are averse from the truth.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:71: Had the truth followed their caprices, the heavens and the earth and whosoever in them is had surely corrupted.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:72: Or dost thou ask them for tribute? Yet the tribute of thy Lord is better, and He is the best of providers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:73: Assuredly thou art calling them to a straight path;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:74: and surely they that believe not in the world to come are deviating from the path.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:75: Did We have mercy on them, and remove the affliction that is upon them, they would persist in their insolence wandering blindly.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:76: We already seized them with the chastisement, yet they abased not themselves to their Lord nor were they humble;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:77: until, when We open against them a door of terrible chastisement, lo, they are sore confounded at it.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:78: It is He who produced for you hearing, and eyes, and hearts; little thanks you show.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:79: It is He who scattered you in the earth, and to Him you shall be mustered.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:80: It is He who gives life, and makes to die, and to Him belongs the alternation of night and day; what, will you not understand?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:81: Nay, but they said the like of what the ancients said.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:82: They said, ’What, when we are dead and become dust and bones, shall we be indeed raised up?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:83: We and our fathers have been promised this before; this is naught but the fairy-tales of the ancients.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:84: Say: ’Whose is the earth, and whoso is in it, if you have knowledge?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:86: Say: ’Who is the Lord of the seven heavens and the Lord of the mighty Throne?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:88: Say: ’In whose hand is the dominion of everything, protecting and Himself unprotected, if you have knowledge?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:90: Nay, but We brought them the truth and they are truly liars.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:91: God has not taken to Himself any son, nor is there any god with Him; for then each god would have taken off that he created and some of them would have risen up over others; glory to be God, beyond that they describe,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:92: who has knowledge of the Unseen and the Visible; high exalted be He, above that they associate!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:93: Say: ’O my Lord, if Thou shouldst show me that they are promised,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:94: O my Lord, put me not among the people of the evildoers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:95: Assuredly, We are able to show thee that We promise them.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:96: Repel thou the evil with that which is fairer.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:97: And say: ’O my Lord, I take refuge in Thee from the evil suggestions of the Satans,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:98: and I take refuge in Thee, O my Lord, lest they attend me.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:99: Till, when death comes to one of them, he says, ’My Lord, return me;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:100: haply I shall do righteousness in that I forsook.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:101: For when the Trumpet is blown, that day there shall be no kinship any more between them, neither will they question one another.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:102: Then he whose scales are heavy -- they are the prosperers,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:103: and he whose scales are light -- they have lost their souls in Gehenna dwelling forever,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:104: the Fire smiting their faces the while they glower there.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:105: ’What, were My signs not recited to you, and you cried them lies?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:106: They shall say, ’Our Lord, our adversity prevailed over us; we were an erring people.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:107: Our Lord, bring us forth out of it! Then, if we revert, we shall be evildoers indeed.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:108: ’Slink you into it,’ He shall say, ’and do not speak to Me.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:109: There is a party of My servants who said, "Our Lord, we believe; therefore forgive us, and have mercy on us, for Thou art the best of the merciful.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:110: But you took them for a laughing-stock, till they made you forget My remembrance, mocking at them.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:111: Now today I have recompensed them for their patient endurance; they are the triumphant.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:112: He shall say, ’How long have you tarried in the earth, by number of years?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:113: They shall say, ’We have tarried a day, or part of a day; ask the numberers!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:114: He shall say, ’You have tarried but a little, did you know.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:115: What, did you think that We created you only for sport, and that you would not be returned to Us?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:116: Then high exalted be God, the King, the True! There is no god but He? the Lord of the noble Throne.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:117: And whosoever calls upon another god with God, whereof he has no proof, his reckoning is with his Lord; surely the unbelievers shall not prosper.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 23:118: And say: ’My Lord, forgive and have mercy, for Thou art the best of the merciful.

Muhammad Asad.verse 23:1: TRULY, to a happy state shall attain the believers:
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:2: those who humble themselves in their prayer,
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:3: and who turn away from all that is frivolous,
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:4: and who are intent on inner purity;
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:5: and who are mindful of their chastity,
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:6: [not giving way to their desires] with any but their spouses – that is, those whom they rightfully possess [through wedlock]: for then, behold, they are free of all blame,
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:7: whereas such as seek to go beyond that
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:9: and who are faithful to their trusts and to their pledges,
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:10: and who guard their prayers [from all worldly intent].
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:11: It is they, they who shall be the inheritors
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:14: NOW, INDEED, We create man out of the essence of clay,
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:15: and then We cause him to remain as a drop of sperm in [the womb’s] firm keeping,
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:16: and then We create out of the drop of sperm a germ-cell, and then We create out of the germ-cell an embryonic lump, and then We create within the embryonic lump bones, and then We clothe the bones with flesh – and then We bring
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:17: this into being as a new creation: hallowed, therefore, is God, the best of artisans!
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:18: And then, behold! after all this, you are destined to die;
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:19: and then, behold! you shall be raised from the dead on Resurrection Day.
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:20: And, indeed, We have created above you seven
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:21: orbits; and never are We unmindful of [any aspect of Our] creation.
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:22: And We send down water from the skies in accordance with a measure [set by Us], and then We cause it to lodge in the earth: but, behold, We are most certainly able to withdraw this !
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:24: We bring forth for you gardens of date-palms and vines, wherein you have fruit abundant and whereof you eat,
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:25: as well as a tree that issues from [the lands adjoining] Mount Sinai, yielding oil and relish for all to eat.
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:27: there is indeed a lesson for you: We give you to drink of that
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:28: which is within their bellies; and you derive many
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:29: uses from them: for you eat of their flesh,
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:30: and by them – as by the ships [over the sea] – you are borne .
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:31: AND, INDEED, We sent forth Noah unto his people, and he said: "O my people! Worship God :
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:32: you have no deity other than Him.
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:33: But the great ones among his people, who refused to acknowledge the truth, replied: "This
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:34: is nothing but a mortal like yourselves who wants to make himself superior to you! For if God had willed [to convey a message unto us], He would surely have sent down angels;
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:35: we have never heard [anything like] this from our forebears of old!
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:36: He is nothing but a madman: so bear with him for a while.
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:38: "O my Sustainer! Succour me against their accusation of lying!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:39: Thereupon We inspired him thus: "Build, under Our eyes and according to Our inspiration, the ark [that shall save thee and those who follow thee].
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:40: one pair of each [kind of animal] of either sex, as well as thy family – excepting those on whom sentence has already been passed – and do not appeal to Me [any more] in behalf of those who are bent on evildoing; for, behold, they are destined to be drowned!
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:41: "And as soon as thou and those who are with thee are settled in the ark, say: ‘All praise is due to God, who has saved us from those evildoing folk!’
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:42: "And say: ‘O my Sustainer! Cause me to reach a destination blessed [by Thee] -for Thou art the best to show man how to reach his
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:45: behold, there are messages indeed [for those who think]: for, verily, We always put
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:47: AND AFTER those [people of old] We gave rise to new generations;
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:48: and [every time] We sent unto them an apostle from among themselves, [he told them:] "Worship God :
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:49: you have no deity other than Him.
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:50: And [every time] the great ones among his people, who refused to acknowledge the truth and gave the lie to the announcement of a life to come –
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:51: because We had granted them ease and plenty in
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:52: worldly life, and they had become corrupted by it – [every time] they would say: "This
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:53: is nothing but a mortal like yourselves, eating of what you eat, and drinking of what you drink:
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:54: and, indeed, if you pay heed to a mortal like yourselves, you will surely be the losers!
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:55: Does he promise you that, after you have died and become
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:56: dust and bones, you shall be brought forth [to a new life]?
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:57: Far-fetched, far-fetched indeed is what you are promised!
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:58: There is no life beyond our life in this world: we die and we live [but once], and we shall never be raised from the dead!
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:59: He is nothing but a man who attributes his own lying inventions to God, and we are not going to believe him!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:60: [Whereupon the prophet] would say: "O my Sustainer! Succour me against their accusation of lying!
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:61: [And God] would say: "After a little while they will surely be smitten with remorse!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:62: And then the blast [of Our punishment] overtook them, justly and unavoidably, and We caused them to become as the flotsam of dead leaves and the scum borne on the surface of a torrent: and so – away with those evildoing folk!
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:63: AND AFTER them We gave rise to new generations:
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:65: no community can ever forestall [the end of] its term – and neither can they delay [its coming].
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:66: And We sent forth Our apostles, one after another:
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:67: every time their apostle came to a community, they gave him the lie: and so We caused them to follow one another [into the grave], and let them become
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:68: tales: and so – away with the folk who would not believe!
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:69: AND THEN We sent forth Moses and his brother Aaron with Our messages and a manifest authority [from Us]
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:70: unto Pharaoh and his great ones; but these behaved with arrogance, for they were people wont to glorify
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:72: And so they said: "Shall we believe [them –] two mortals like ourselves – although their people are our slaves?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:73: Thus, they gave the lie to those two, and earned
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:75: for, indeed, We had vouchsafed revelation unto Moses in order that they might find the right way.
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:76: And [as We exalted Moses, so, too,] We made the son of Mary and his mother a symbol [of Our grace], and provided for both an abode in a lofty place of lasting restfulness and unsullied springs.
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:77: O YOU APOSTLES! Partake of the good things of life, and do righteous deeds: verily, I have full knowledge of all that you do.
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:78: And, verily, this community of yours is one single community, since I am the Sustainer of you all: remain, then, conscious of Me!
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:79: But they [who claim to follow you] have torn their unity wide asunder, piece by piece, each group delighting in
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:80: what they themselves possess [by way of tenets].
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:81: But leave them alone, lost in their ignorance, until a
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:83: Do they think that by all the wealth and offspring with which We provide them
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:84: We [but want to] make them vie with one another in doing [what they consider] good works? Nay, but they do not perceive [their error]!
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:86: they who stand in reverent awe of their Sustainer,
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:87: and who believe in their Sustainer’s messages,
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:88: and who do not ascribe divinity to aught but their Sustainer,
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:89: and who give whatever they [have to] give with their hearts trembling at the thought that unto their Sustainer they must return:
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:90: it is they who vie with one another in doing good works, and it is they who outrun [all others] in attaining to them!
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:92: We do not burden any human being with more than he is well able to bear: for with Us is a record that speaks the truth [about what men do and can do]; and none shall be wronged.
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:93: NAY, [as for those who have torn asunder the unity of faith–] their hearts are lost in ignorance of all this! But apart from that [breach of unity] they have [on their conscience even worse] deeds; and they will [continue to] commit them
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:94: until – after We shall have taken to task, through suffering, those from among them who
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:95: are lost in the pursuit of pleasures – they cry out in
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:97: [But they will be told:] "Cry not in supplication today: for, behold, you shall not be succoured by Us!
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:98: Time and again were My messages conveyed unto you, but [every time] you would turn about on your heels
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:100: impelled by your arrogance, you would talk senselessly far into the night.
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:101: Have they, then, never tried to understand this word [of God]? Or has there
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:102: come to them something that never came to their forefathers of old?
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:103: Or is it, perchance, that they have not recognized their Apostle, and so they disavow him?
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:104: Or do they say, "There is madness in him"? Nay, he has brought them the truth – and the truth do most of them detest!
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:105: But if the truth were in accord with their own likes and dislikes, the heavens and the earth would surely have fallen into ruin, and all that lives in them [would long ago have perished]! Nay, [in this divine writ] We have conveyed unto them all that they ought to bear in mind: and from this their reminder they
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:107: Or dost thou [O Muhammad] ask of them any worldly recompense? But [they ought to know that] a recompense from thy Sustainer is best, since He is the best of providers!
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:108: And, verily, thou callest them onto a straight way
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:109: but, behold, those who will not believe in the life to come are bound to deviate from that way.
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:110: And even were We to show them mercy and remove whatever distress might befall them [in this life], they would still persist in their overweening arrogance, blindly stumbling to and fro.
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:111: And, indeed, We tested them through suffering, but they did not abase themselves before their Sustainer; and they will never humble themselves
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:112: until We open before them a gate of
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:113: severe suffering [in the life to come]: and then, lo! they will be broken in spirit.
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:114: [O MEN! Pay heed to God’s messages,] for it is He who has endowed you with hearing, and sight, and minds:
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:116: And He it is who has caused you to multiply on earth; and unto Him you shall be gathered.
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:117: And He it is who grants life and deals death; and to Him is due the alternation of night and day.
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:118: But nay, they speak as the people of olden times did speak:
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:119: they say: "What! After we have died and become mere dust and bones, shall we, forsooth, be raised from the dead?
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:120: Indeed, this [very thing] we have been promised – we and our forefathers – long ago! This is nothing but fables of ancient times!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:121: Say: "Unto whom belongs the earth and all that lives thereon? [Tell me this] if you happen to know [the answer]!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:124: Say: "Who is it that sustains the seven heavens and is enthroned in His awesome almightiness?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:126: they will reply: "[All this power belongs] to God.
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:127: Say: "In whose hand rests the mighty dominion over all things, and who is it that protects, the while there is no protection against Him? [Tell me this] if you happen to know [the answer]!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:129: they will reply: "[All this power belongs] to God.
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:130: Nay, We have conveyed unto them the truth: and yet, behold, they are intent on lying [to themselves]!
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:131: Never did God take unto Himself any offspring, nor has there ever been any deity side by side with Him: [for, had there been any,] lo! each deity would surely have stood apart [from the others] in whatever it had created, and they would surely have [tried to] overcome one another! Limitless in His glory is God,
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:132: above anything that men may devise by way of definition,
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:133: knowing all that is beyond the reach of a created being’s perception as well as all that can be witnessed by a creature’s senses or mind – and, hence, sublimely exalted is He above anything to which they may ascribe a share in His divinity!
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:134: SAY: "O my Sustainer! If it be Thy will to let me witness [the fulfilment of] whatever they [who blaspheme against Thee] have been promised [to suffer]
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:135: do not, O my Sustainer, let me be one of those evildoing folk!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:136: [Pray thus –] for, behold, We are most certainly able to let thee witness [the fulfilment, even in this world, of] whatever We promise them!
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:137: [But whatever they may say or do,] repel the evil [which they commit] with something that is better: We are fully aware of what they attribute [to Us].
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:138: And say: "O my Sustainer! I seek refuge with Thee from the promptings of all evil impulses;
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:139: and I seek refuge with Thee, O my Sustainer, lest they come near unto me!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:140: [AS FOR THOSE who will not believe in the life to come, they go on lying to themselves] until, when death approaches any of them, he prays: "O my Sustainer! Let me return, let me return [to life],
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:141: so that I might act righteously in whatever I have failed !"
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:142: Nay, it is indeed but a
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:143: word that he utters: for behind those [who leave the world] there is a barrier [of death] until the Day when all will be raised from the dead!
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:144: Then, when the trumpet [of resurrection] is blown, no ties of kinship will on that Day prevail among them, and neither will they ask about one another.
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:145: And they whose weight [of righteousness] is heavy in the balance – it is they, they who will have attained to a happy state,
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:146: whereas they whose weight is light in the balance – it is they who will have squandered their own selves,
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:148: the fire will scorch their faces, and they will abide therein with their lips distorted in pain.
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:149: [And God will say:] "Were not My messages conveyed unto you, and were you
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:150: wont to give them the lie?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:151: They will exclaim: "O our Sustainer! Our bad luck has overwhelmed us, and so we went astray!
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:152: O our Sustainer! Cause us to come out of this
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:153: – and then, if ever We revert [to sinning], may we truly be
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:156: He will say: "Away with you into this !
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:157: And speak no more unto Me!
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:158: "Behold, there were among My servants such as would pray, ‘O our Sustainer! We have come to believe [in Thee]; forgive, then, our sins and bestow Thy mercy on us: for Thou art the truest bestower of mercy!’
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:159: but you made them a target of your derision to the point where it made you forget all remembrance of Me; and you went on and on laughing at them.
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:161: behold, today I have rewarded them for their patience in adversity: verily, it is they, they who have achieved a triumph!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:163: He will ask [the doomed]: "What number of years have you spent on earth?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:164: They will answer: "We have spent there a day, or part of a day; but ask those who [are able to] count ….
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:166: He will say: "You have spent there but a short while: had you but known [how short it was to be]!
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:167: Did you, then, think that We created you in mere idle play, and that you would not have to return to Us?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:169: God is sublimely exalted, the Ultimate Sovereign, the Ultimate Truth: there is no deity save Him, the Sustainer, in bountiful almightiness enthroned!
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:170: Hence, he who invokes, side by side with God, any other deity [– a deity] for whose existence he has no evidence – shall but find his reckoning with his Sustainer:
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:171: verily, such deniers of the truth will never attain to a happy state!
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:172: Hence, [O believer,] say: "O my Sustainer! Grant
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:173: forgiveness and bestow Thy mercy [upon me]: for Thou art the truest bestower of mercy!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:174: purity,” which is the meaning of zakāh in this context (Zamakhsharī; the same interpretation has been advanced by Abū Muslim).
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:176: In the first instance, this verse refers to the various religious groups as such: that is to say, to the followers of one or another of the earlier revelations who, in the course of time, consolidated themselves within different “denominations,” each of them jealously guarding its own set of tenets, dogmas, and rituals and intensely intolerant of all other ways of worship (manāsik, see 22:67).
Muhammad Asad.verse 23:177: hasten on [the coming] to them of all that is good?” Either of these two renderings implies, firstly, that worldly prosperity is not the ultimate good, and, secondly, that the breach of the unity spoken of in the preceding passage was, more often than not, an outcome of mere worldly greed and of factional striving after power.

Martin Lings.verse 23:1: Deem ye that We did but create you in vain and that ye shall not be brought back unto Us.

Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:1: Success is really attained by the believers
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:2: who concentrate their attention in humbleness when offering Salāh (prayers)
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:3: and who keep themselves away from vain things,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:4: and who are performers of Zakāh ,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:5: and who guard their private parts
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:6: except from their wives or from those (bondwomen who are) owned by their hands, as they are not to be blamed.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:7: However, those who seek (sexual pleasure) beyond that are the transgressors
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:8: - and (success is attained) by those who honestly look after their trusts and covenant,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:9: and who consistently observe their prayers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:12: We have created man from an extract of clay.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:13: Then We made him a sperm-drop in a firm resting place.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:14: Then We turned the sperm-drop into a clot, then We turned the clot into a fetus-lump, then We turned the fetus-lump into bones, then We clothed the bones with flesh; thereafter We developed it into another creature.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:15: Then, after all this, you are to die.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:16: Then you are to be raised again on the Day of Judgment.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:17: And We created above you seven paths (heavens), and We were never neglectful of the creation.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:18: And We sent down water from the sky in due measure, then We lodged it in the earth, and of course, We are able to take it away.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:19: Then We produced with it gardens of date-palms and vines for your benefit.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:20: - and (We produced) a tree (of olive) that comes forth from the (mount) Tūr of Sinai, which grows with oil and with a dressing for those who eat.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:21: And indeed there is a sure lesson in the cattle for you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:22: and on them and on the boats you are transported.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:23: Surely, We sent NūH to his nation.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:24: So, said the disbelieving chiefs from among his nation, “This (man) is nothing but a human being like you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:25: He is none but a man suffering from madness; so wait for (what happens to) him until some time”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:26: He said, “My Lord, help me, for they have rejected me.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:27: So, We sent Our revelation to him, saying, “Make the ship under Our eyes and Our revelation.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:28: So, when you and those with you are well seated in the ship, say, ‘Praise is for Allah who saved us from the wrongdoing people.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:29: And say, ‘My Lord, make me land a blessed landing, and You are the best of those who bring (someone) to land’”.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:30: Surely, there are signs in it, and We do always test (people).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:31: Then after them We created another generation,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:32: and sent among them a messenger from themselves (to convey the message): “Worship Allah; you have no god whatsoever other than Him.
