Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:33: Then said the chiefs of his nation who were disbelievers and who denied facing the Hereafter and whom We made affluent in the worldly life, “This (man) is nothing but a human being.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:34: If you obey a human like yourselves, then you will be absolute losers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:35: Does he promise you that, when you die and are turned into dust and bones, you are to be brought forth?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:36: Far too improbable is what you are being promised.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:37: There is nothing but our worldly life.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:38: He is nothing but a man who has forged a lie against Allah, and we are not going to believe in him.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:39: He said, “My Lord, help me, for they have rejected me.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:40: He (Allah) said, “In a little while they will have to be remorseful.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:41: So the Cry seized them according to the true (promise), and We turned them in to scum.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:42: Then, after them, We created another generation.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:43: No community can go ahead of its appointed time, nor can they become late.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:44: Thereafter, We sent Our messengers successively.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:45: Thereafter, We sent Mūsā and his brother Hārūn with Our signs and a clear proof
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:47: So they said, “shall we believe in two humans who are like ourselves and whose people are serving us as slaves?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:48: Thus they rejected both of them and were among the destroyed.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:49: And, of course, We gave Mūsā the Book, so that they may take the right path.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:50: And We made the son of Maryam (Mary) and his mother a sign, and gave them shelter on a height, having a place of rest and running springs.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:51: O messengers, eat from the good things, and act righteously.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:52: Surely, this is your creed, a single creed, and I am your Lord.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:53: But they split up ways from one another (dividing themselves) into factions, each faction happy with what lies before it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:54: So leave them in their negligence for some time.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:55: Do they think that by consistently providing them with wealth and children,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:56: We are accelerating the (real) good things to them? The fact, however, is that they do not understand (the reality).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:57: (Contrarily) those who are anxious out of awe of their Lord,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:58: and those who believe in the verses of their Lord
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:59: and those who do not associate any partner to their Lord,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:60: And those who give whatever they give, with their hearts full of fear that to their Lord they are to return
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:61: - those people are accelerating towards the (real) good things, and they are the foremost to attain them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:62: We do not place a burden on anyone except according to his ability.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:63: But their hearts are in ignorance about this, and they have deeds, other than that, which they are continuously doing.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:64: Until when We will seize their affluent ones with punishment, they will suddenly start crying.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:65: (Then it will be said to them,) “Do not cry today.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:66: My verses used to be recited to you, but you used to turn back on your heels
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:67: in arrogance, making it a subject of tales at night, talking nonsense (about it).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:68: Then, is it that they did not ponder over the Word (of Allah), or there has come to them something that did not come to their forefathers?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:69: Or did they not recognize their messenger and therefore they denied him?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:70: Or do they say, “He is suffering from madness?” No, but he has come to them with truth, but it is the truth that most of them dislike.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:71: Had the truth followed their desires, the heavens and the earth and all those therein would have fallen in total disorder.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:72: Or is it that you (O Prophet) demand remuneration from them? But the remuneration from your Lord is best, and He is the best of all givers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:73: Surely you are inviting them to a straight path,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:74: and those who do not believe in the Hereafter are surely the deviators from the Path.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:75: And if We have mercy on them and remove whatever distress they have, they would still persist obstinately in their rebellion, wandering blindly (in disbelief).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:76: We have already seized them with punishment, but they did not turn humble to their Lord, nor do they supplicate in humility,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:77: until when We will open against them the door of a severe punishment, they will be taken aback in despair.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:78: He is the One who created for you ears and eyes and hearts.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:79: And He is the One who created you on the earth, and it is He unto whom you will be gathered together.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:80: And He is the One who gives life and brings death, and it is He who controls the alternation of night and day.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:81: But they say as the earlier people had said.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:82: They said, “Is it that, when we will die and become dust and bones - is it that we will be raised again?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:83: This is what has been promised to us and to our fathers before.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:84: Say, “Whose is the earth and all those therein if you have knowledge?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:86: Say, “Who is the Lord of the seven heavens and the Lord of the Great Throne?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:87: They will say, “(All this belongs) to Allah”.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:88: Say, “Who is the One in whose hand lies the kingdom of every thing and who gives protection, and no protection can be given against him, if you have knowledge?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:89: They will say, “(All this belongs) to Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:90: The fact is that We have brought to them The Truth, and they are absolute liars.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:91: Allah has not taken a son to Himself, nor was there any god with Him.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:92: He is the Knower of the hidden and the manifest.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:93: (O prophet) say (in prayer), “O my Lord, if You are to show me (in my life) that (punishment) which they (the infidels) are threatened with,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:94: then, my Lord, do not place me among the wrongdoing people.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:95: And of course, We do have the power to show you that with which We have threatened them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:96: Repel evil with that which is best.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:97: And say, “My Lord, I seek refuge in You from the strokes of the satans (devils),
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:98: and I seek refuge in You, my Lord, even from their coming near me.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:99: (The infidels go on doing their misdeeds) until when death comes to one of them, he will say, “My Lord send me back,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:100: so that I may act righteously in that (world) which I have left behind.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:101: Thereafter, when the Sūr (the trumpet) is blown, no ties of kinship will remain between them any more, nor will they inquire about one another.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:102: So, the one whose scales (of good deeds) turn out to be heavy, then such people are the successful ones,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:103: and the one whose scales turn out to be light, then such people are the ones who harmed their own selves; in Jahannam (Hell) they are to remain for ever.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:104: Fire will scorch their faces, and they will be disfigured therein.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:105: (It will be said to such people), “Were My verses not used to be recited to you and you used to reject them?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:106: They will say, “Our Lord, our wretchedness prevailed over us, and we were a people wandering astray.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:107: Our Lord, get us out from here; if we do this again, then of course, we will be transgressors.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:108: He (Allah) will say, “Stay in it, humiliated, and do not speak to Me.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:109: There was indeed a group of My servants who used to say, ‘Our Lord, we adhere to the (true) faith, so forgive us and have mercy upon us, and you are the best of all the merciful.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:110: But you made fun of them, so much so that they caused you to forget My remembrance, and you used to laugh at them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:111: Today I have so recompensed them for their observing patience that they are the triumphant.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:112: He (Allah) will say (to unbelievers), “How long did you stay on the earth by number of years?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:113: They will say, “We stayed for a day or for a part of a day.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:114: He will say, “You did not stay but for a little.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:115: So did you think that We created you for nothing, and that you will not be brought back to Us?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:116: So, High above all is Allah, the King, the True.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:117: And whoever invokes another god with Allah, while he has no proof for it, his reckoning is only with his Lord.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 23:118: And say (O prophet) “My Lord, grant pardon and have mercy, for you are the best of all the merciful.

Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:2: those who in their prayers are humble,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:4: and who fulfil payment of alms,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:5: and who guard their private parts,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:6: except from their spouses, and what
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:7: their right hands possess, for then they are not blameworthy.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:9: beyond that, those, they are transgressors.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:10: And who are keepers of their trusts and covenants.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:11: And who are watchful of their prayers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:13: who shall inherit Paradise, wherein they will abide.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:14: And We certainly created man from an extraction of clay.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:15: Then We made him a drop in a secure lodging.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:16: Then We transformed the drop [of semen] into a clot.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:19: Then indeed after that you die.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:20: Then on the Day of Resurrection you shall surely be raised.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:21: And verily We created above you seven paths, and of creation We are never unmindful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:22: And We sent down water out of the heaven in measure, and We lodged it within the earth; and We are indeed able to take it away.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:23: Then We produced for you therewith gardens of date palms and vines wherein is abundant fruit for you, and whereof you eat.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:24: And a tree that grows on Mount of Sinai that produces oil and seasoning for those who eat.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:25: And surely in the cattle there is for you a lesson.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:26: And on them and on ships you are carried.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:27: And verily We sent Noah to his people, and he said, 'O my people, worship God.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:29: But the council of his people, who disbelieved, said, 'This is just a human being like you who desires to gain superiority over you.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:30: He is just a man possessed by madness.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:31: He said, 'My Lord, help me because they deny me'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:33: 'Build the Ark under Our watch and
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:35: And when you have settled in the Ark together with those with you, say, "Praise be to God Who has delivered us from the wrongdoing folk".
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:36: And say: "My Lord, cause me to land with a landing blessed, for You are the best of all who bring to land" '.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:37: Surely in that there are signs, and indeed We were putting to the test.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:38: Then, after them, We brought forth another generation.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:39: And We sent among them a messenger of their own, saying, 'Worship God! You have no other god besides Him.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:40: The council of his people, who disbelieved and denied the encounter of the Hereafter, and whom We had given affluence in the life of this world, said: 'This is only a human being like you: he eats what you eat and drinks what you drink.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:41: And if you obey a human being like yourselves you will surely then be losers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:42: Does he promise you that when you have died and become dust and bones, you shall be brought forth?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:43: Far-fetched, far-fetched is what you are promised!
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:44: There is nothing but our life in this world: we die, and we live, and we shall not be raised .
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:45: He is just a man who has invented a lie against God, and we will not believe in him'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:46: He said, 'My Lord, help me because they have denied me'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:47: He said, 'In a little while they will become remorseful'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:48: So the Cry seized them rightfully, and We made them as husks.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:49: Then, after them, We brought forth other generations.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:50: No community can precede its term, nor be deferred.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:51: Then sent We Our messengers successively.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:52: Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron with Our signs and a manifest warrant
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:53: to Pharaoh and his council; but they disdained, and they were a tyrannical folk.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:54: And they said, 'Shall we believe two humans like ourselves, while their people are servile to us?'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:56: and became of those who were destroyed.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:57: And verily We gave Moses the Scripture that perhaps they might be guided.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:58: And We made the son of Mary and his mother a sign.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:59: O messengers, eat of the good things and perform righteous acts.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:60: Verily this your community is one community and I am your Lord, so fear Me'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:61: But they split into sects regarding their affair, each party rejoicing in what is with them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:62: So leave them in their error for a while.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:63: Do they suppose that in the wealth and children with which We provide them,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:65: them with good things? Rather, they are not aware.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:66: Surely those who, for fear of their Lord, are apprehensive,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:67: and who believe in the signs of their Lord,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:68: and who do not associate others with their Lord,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:69: and who give what they give, while their hearts tremble [with awe], because they are going to return to their Lord -
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:70: those [are the ones who] hasten to
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:71: good works, and they [are the ones who] shall come out ahead in them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:72: And We do not task any soul beyond its capacity, and with Us is a Record that speaks the truth; and they will not be wronged.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:73: Nay, but their hearts are in ignorance of this, and they have other deeds which they will perpetrate, besides, which they are doing.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:74: Indeed when We seize their affluent ones with chastisement, behold! They are supplicating loudly.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:75: 'Do not supplicate [out loud] on this day! Truly you will not receive help against Us.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:76: Verily My signs used to be recited to you, but you used to take to your heels,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:77: disdainful because of it, while in
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:79: Have they not contemplated the discourse, or has there come upon them that which has not come upon their forefathers?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:80: Or is it that they do not recognise their
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:81: Messenger and so they reject him?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:82: Or do they say, 'There is a madness in him'? Nay, he has brought them the truth; but most of them are averse to the truth.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:83: And if the truth had followed their desires, indeed the heavens and the earth and whoever is in them would have been corrupted.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:85: Or do you ask them for any recompense? Yet the recompense of your Lord is better and He is the best of providers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:86: And truly you summon them to a straight path.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:87: And truly those who do not believe in the Hereafter, deviate from the path.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:88: And had We shown them mercy and relieved them of the harm afflicting them, they would surely persist in their insolence, bewildered.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:89: And We have already seized them with chastisement, yet they did not humble themselves to their Lord, nor did they devote themselves to prayer.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:90: Until when We opened on them the gate of a severe chastisement, behold! they are aghast thereat.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:91: And He it is Who made for you hearing, and eyes, and hearts.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:92: And He it is Who dispersed you on earth, and to Him you shall be gathered.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:93: And He it is Who gives life and brings death, and due to Him is the alternation of night and day.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:94: Nay, but they say the like of what the ancients said.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:95: They said, 'What, when we are dead and have become dust and bones, shall we then be raised?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:96: Already We and our fathers have been promised this before: these are nothing but the fables of the ancients'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:97: Say: 'To whom does the earth and whoever is in it belong, if you
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:100: Say: 'Who is the Lord of the seven heavens and the Lord of the Great Throne?'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:102: Say: 'In whose hand is the dominion of all things and who protects, while from Him there is no protection, if you know?'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:104: Nay, but We have brought them the truth, and they are indeed liars.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:105: God has not taken any son, nor is there any god along with Him; for then each god would have taken away what he created, and some of them would surely rise up against others.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:106: Knower of the Unseen and the visible, and exalted be He above what they associate!
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:107: Say: 'My Lord! If You should show me what they are promised,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:108: my Lord, then do no put me among the evildoing folk'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:109: And truly We are able to show you what We promise them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:110: Ward off with that which is better the evil .
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:111: We know best what they allege.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:112: And say: 'My Lord, I seek protection in You from the promptings of devils.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:113: And I seek protection in You, my Lord, lest they visit me'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:114: Until when death comes to one of them, he says, 'My Lord! Send me back,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:115: that I might act righteously in that which I have left behind'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:116: And when the Trumpet is blown, there will be no more ties [of kinship] between them on that day, nor will they question one another.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:117: Then those whose scales are heavy, they are the successful,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:118: and those whose scales are light, they are the ones who have lost their souls, abiding in Hell.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:119: The Fire will scorch their faces, while they glower therein:
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:120: 'Were not My signs recited to you, and you used to deny them?'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:121: They will say, 'Our Lord, our wretchedness overcame us, and we were an erring folk.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:122: Our Lord, bring us out of it! Then, if we revert, we will indeed be evildoers'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:123: He will say, ‘Begone in it, and do not speak to Me.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:124: Indeed there was a party of My servants who would say, "Our Lord, we believe; therefore forgive us, and have mercy on us, for You are the best of the merciful".
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:125: But then you took them as an object of ridicule until they made you forget My remembrance, and you used to laugh at them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:126: Indeed I have rewarded them this day for the endurance they showed.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:127: He will say, 'How long did you tarry in the earth in years?'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:128: They will say, 'We tarried a day, or part of a day.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:129: He will say, 'You tarried but a little, if only you knew.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:130: Did you suppose that We created you aimlessly and that you would not be returned to Us?'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:131: So exalted be God, the King, the Truth! There is no god except Him, the Lord of the Noble Throne.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:132: And he who calls on another god along with God has no proof thereof, his reckoning will indeed be with his Lord.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 23:133: And say: 'My Lord, forgive and have mercy, and You are the best of the merciful'.

Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:1: Certainly, the believers have attained their goal,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:2: Those who become most humble and submissive in their Prayers,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:3: And who (always) keep away from absurd talk,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:4: And who (always) pay Zakat (the Alms-due [and keep purifying their wealth and souls]),
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:5: And who guard their private parts (all the time),
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:6: Except from their wives or those slave-girls who are the possessions of their hands.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:7: But whoever desires someone beyond these (lawful women), it is they who are transgressors (and disobedient).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:8: And those who are watchful of their trusts and their pledges,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:9: And who guard their Prayers (with persistence),
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:10: It is they who will be the inheritors (of Paradise).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:11: They will (also) inherit the most superior Gardens of Paradise (where all the bounties, comforts and pleasures of nearness to Allah will abound).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:12: And indeed, We originated (the genesis of) man from the extract of (chemical ingredients of) clay.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:13: Then We placed him as a sperm drop (zygote) in a secure place (the mother’s womb).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:14: Then We made that zygote a hanging mass (clinging to the uterus like a leech).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:15: Then certainly, after this (life), you shall die.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:16: Then indeed, on the Day of Resurrection, you will be raised up (after brought to life).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:17: And surely, We have created above you seven paths (i.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:18: And We showered water persistently (for a long time) from the clouds according to an estimated measure.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:19: Then by means of this We caused to grow for you (step by step firstly herbs, then plants and then trees and) the gardens of dates and grapes.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:20: And (We have also created for you the olive) tree, which grows forth from Mount Sinai, (and) contains oil, and is a curry for those who eat.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:21: And for you indeed there are (also) aspects to the cattle that need contemplation: We make you drink (milk We prepare from some ingredients) of what is in their bellies.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:22: And you are (also) borne upon them and on boats.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:23: And surely, We sent Nuh (Noah) to his people.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:24: Then the chiefs (and the lords) of his people who disbelieved said: ‘This man is just a human being like you (nothing else).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:25: He is nothing but a man (afflicted) with madness.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:26: Nuh (Noah) submitted: ‘O my Lord, help me because they have rejected me.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:27: Then We revealed to him: ‘Build an Ark under Our supervision according to Our command.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:28: So when you and the (people) accompanying you get settled in the Ark, then say: All praise be to Allah alone, Who has delivered us from the unjust people.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:29: And submit: O my Lord, land me at a blessed destination, and You are the Best of all who bring to land.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:30: Surely in this (event), there are (many) signs and We do certainly make trials.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:31: Then We raised after them another community.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:32: So We sent amongst them (also) a Messenger from amongst themselves: ‘Worship Allah.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:33: And thus proclaimed the chiefs (and the lords) of his people (too) who disbelieved and rejected the meeting of the Hereafter and whom We had (also) given prosperity (on account of abundant wealth) in the worldly life: ‘He is only a human being like you.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:34: And if you obey a human being like yourselves, then you shall be the sure losers.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:35: Does he promise you that, when you die and become dust and (decomposed) bones, you will be brought forth (alive again)?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:36: Far (from understanding), far (off from likelihood) are the things you are being promised.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:37: There is nothing (like life after death).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:38: He is merely a man who has put a false blame on Allah, and we are not going to believe in him at all.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:39: (The Prophet) submitted: ‘O my Lord, help me in the circumstances that they have rejected me.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:40: (Allah) said: ‘They will be full of regret in a little while.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:41: So, according to the true promise, the dreadful Blast seized them, and We made them a waste of withered grass.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:42: Later We raised after them other communities (one after the other).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:43: No community can step ahead of its appointed time, nor can it step back.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:44: Then We sent Our Messengers one after the other.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:45: Then We sent Musa (Moses) and his brother Harun (Aaron) with Our signs and an evident authority,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:46: To Pharaoh and the chiefs (of his people).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:47: So they (also) said (the same): ‘Shall we believe in two human beings like ourselves whilst their people worship us?’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:49: And indeed, We gave Musa (Moses) the Book so that they might take guidance.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:50: And We made ‘Isa (Jesus), the son of Maryam (Mary), and his mother Our (great) sign.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:51: O (My Esteemed) Messengers! Eat of the pure things (as your practice is) and do good deeds with persistence.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:52: And surely, this is your Umma (
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:53: which is in fact) but one Umma (Community) and I am your Lord.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:54: But they broke the command of their din (religion) into sects by disagreeing amongst themselves.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:56: So leave them ditched in their ignorance and error for a time.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:57: Do they think that the help We are giving them (in this world) in the shape of wealth and children,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:58: (Implies that) We are hastening (the provision of) good things to them? (Nay!) The truth is that they have no awareness.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:59: Indeed, those who remain restless and tremble with fear of their Lord,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:60: And those who believe in the Revelations of their Lord,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:61: And those who do not associate (any) partners with their Lord,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:62: And those who give away (in the way of Allah as much) as they can, yet (in spite of that) their hearts fear that they are to return to their Lord (lest it should be rejected),
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:63: It is these people who are hastening in (collecting) good works, and it is they who excel in this pursuit.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:64: And We do not strain any soul but commensurate with its capacity, and with Us is the record (of deeds) which will speak the truth, and they will not be wronged.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:65: But their hearts are in (utter) negligence of this (message of the Qur’an) and (also) besides that, there are many other (evil) deeds which they are doing,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:66: Until when We seize the rich and the prosperous of them with torment, then they will cry out.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:67: (It will be said to them:) ‘Do not cry today.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:68: Certainly, My Verses were repeatedly recited to you but you used to turn back on your heels.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:69: Displaying haughtiness and arrogance against it, you used to utter absurdity in the darkness of night.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:70: So have they not pondered over this command (of Allah)? Or has there come to them such a thing that did not come to their fathers?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:71: Or have they not recognized their Messenger and (so) they deny him?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:72: Or do they say: ‘He (the Prophet) is (afflicted) with mania’? (Nay, not at all;) he has rather brought to them the truth, but most of them do not like the truth.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:73: And had the (holy) truth (Allah) followed their vain desires, then (all) the heavens and the earth and whatever (living and non-living things) are therein, all would have been destroyed.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:74: Do you demand of them any recompense (for preaching the faith in Messengership? Nay, that too is not the case.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:75: And surely, you call them to the straight path (for their own good).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:76: And surely, those who do not believe in the Hereafter remain deviated from the (straight) path.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:77: And if We have mercy on them and remove the distress that has (afflicted) them, they will become hardened in their transgression, wandering disorientated.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:78: And indeed, We seized them with torment, but (still) they did not adopt submissiveness to their Lord, nor did they entreat in humility (before His presence),
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:79: Until when We open to them the gate of an extremely harsh torment, (then,) at that time, taken aback, they will (stay) therein, stunned in despair.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:80: And He is the One Who (gradually) made for you ears and eyes and hearts (and minds), but you give very little thanks.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:81: And He is the One Who created and then scattered you in the earth, and before Him will you be gathered.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:82: And He is the One Who gives life and causes death, and in His control is (also) the alternation of night and day.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:83: But these people (too) utter similar words that the former (disbelievers) used to utter.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:84: They say: ‘When we die and turn into dust and (decomposed) bones, then shall we be raised up (after given life again)?’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:85: Surely, this is what we and our fathers have (also) been promised.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:86: Say (to them): ‘To whom belongs the earth and everyone (living) in it, if you know (anything)?’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:87: They will promptly say: ‘(All) belongs to Allah.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:88: Ask (them): ‘Who is the Lord of the seven heavens and the Mighty Throne (i.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:89: They will spontaneously say: ‘(All) this belongs to Allah.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:90: Say (to them): ‘Who is He in Whose Mighty Hand is the absolute ownership of everything and Who gives asylum, but against Whom no asylum can be given, if you know (anything)?’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:91: They will readily say: ‘That is all Allah’s (glory).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:92: The fact is that We have brought them the truth, and they are liars without any doubt.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:93: Allah has not taken (to Himself) any son, nor is there any god with Him.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:94: (He) is the Knower of (all things) hidden and disclosed.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:95: Pray: ‘O my Lord, if You would show me that (torment) which they are being promised,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:96: (Then,) my Lord, put me not amongst the unjust people.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:97: And We certainly have the power to show you that (torment) of which We are making them a promise.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:98: Repel evil in such a way as is best of all.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:99: And say, (praying): ‘O my Lord, I seek Your shelter from the promptings of the satans.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:100: And, O my Lord, also I seek refuge with You lest they should come to me.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:101: Until when death comes to any of them, (then) he will say: ‘O my Lord, send me back (to the world),
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:102: So that I may do some righteous works in that (world) which I have left behind.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:103: Then when the trumpet will be blown, neither will any relation remain (intact) amongst them that Day, nor will they be able to ask of one another.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:104: So they whose scales will weigh heavy (due to a great number of good deeds) will be successful and prosperous.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:105: And the ones whose scales will be light (due to the little weight of good deeds), it is they who have harmed themselves.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:106: The Fire will burn their faces, and they will be lying in it with teeth bulging out and mouths deformed.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:107: (It will be said to them:) ‘Were My Revelations not repeatedly recited to you, and then you used to belie them?’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:108: They will say: ‘O our Lord, our misfortune overwhelmed us, and surely we were the misguided people.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:109: O our Lord! Take us out from here.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:110: (Allah will) say: ‘Stay on therein with disgrace and do not speak to Me.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:111: Indeed, there was a party of My servants who used to submit (before My presence): O our Lord, we have believed, so forgive us and have mercy on us.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:112: But you used to laugh at them till they made you forget My remembrance and you (just) continued making fun of them.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:113: This Day, I have bestowed upon them (this) reward for their patience that they have triumphed.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:114: (Allah) will say: ‘How many years have you stayed in the earth?’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:115: They will say: ‘We might have stayed there a day or part of a day, but ask those who work out statistics.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:116: (Allah) will say: ‘You stayed there but very little.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:117: So did you think that We had created you in vain (without any purpose) and that you would not return to Us?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:118: So Allah, the True Sovereign, is High and Exalted.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:119: And anyone who worships another god along with Allah has no proof of this.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 23:120: And submit: ‘O my Lord, forgive and have mercy, and You (alone) are the Best of those who have mercy.

null.verse 23:2: ne, jotka nöyrtyvät rukoillessaan,
null.verse 23:3: ja jotka karttavat turhanpäiväistä puhetta,
null.verse 23:6: paitsi vaimojensa ja orjattariensa parissa, jolloin heitä ei soimata.
null.verse 23:7: Mutta ne, jotka menevät tätä pitemmälle, he ovat synnintekijöitä.
null.verse 23:8: Uskovaisia ovat myös ne, jotka vartioivat uskottua omaisuutta ja pitävät sopimuksensa;
null.verse 23:9: ja ne, jotka pitävät vaarin rukouksistaan.
null.verse 23:11: Paratiisin he saavat periä, ja siellä he tulevat asumaan.
null.verse 23:12: Totisesti muovailimme ihmisen puhtaasta savesta.
null.verse 23:13: Sitten sijoitimme elon siemenen varmaan suojaan.
null.verse 23:14: Senjälkeen kehitimme siemenestä verenalun, ja hyytyneestä verestä kehitimme lihanrungon; lihanrungossa rakensimme luut ja luut ympäröimme lihalla.
null.verse 23:15: Tämän jälkeen teidän on totisesti kuoltava;
null.verse 23:16: mutta ylösnousemuksen päivänä teidät jälleen herätetään eloon.
null.verse 23:17: Totisesti, yläpuolellenne olemme rakentanut seitsemän taivaan rataa; emme konsanaan jätä huolenpitoa luomisesta.
null.verse 23:18: Pilvistä lähetämme sadetta maan päälle määrän mukaan ja annamme sen jäädä maahan, ja totisesti kykenemme myös sen ottamaan pois.
null.verse 23:19: Veden avulla Me sitten kasvatamme teille puutarhoja palmupuineen ja viiniköynnöksineen.
null.verse 23:20: Me kasvatamme myös puun, joka kohoaa Siinain vuorella, ja se tuottaa teille öljyä ja mehua nautittavaksenne.
null.verse 23:21: Myös nelijalkaisissa teille on opetus.
null.verse 23:22: Se kantaa teitä myös samoin kuin laivatkin.
null.verse 23:23: Ja tapahtui, että Me lähetimme Nooan kansansa luokse, ja hän lausui: »Oi kansani, palvelkaa Jumalaa; teillä ei ole muuta jumalaa kuin Hän.
null.verse 23:24: Silloin hänen kansansa uskottomien päämiehet sanoivat: »Hän on vain kuolevainen kuten tekin ja yrittää kohottaa itsensä teidän yläpuolellenne.
null.verse 23:25: Hän on vain hullu mies, siksi sietäkäämme häntä aikansa.
null.verse 23:26: Nooa lausui: »Herra, auta minua, koska he leimaavat minut valehtelijaksi.
null.verse 23:27: Silloin Me annoimme hänelle ilmoituksemme näin sanoen: »Rakenna itsellesi arkki silmiemme edessä ja käskyjemme mukaan.
null.verse 23:28: Kun sinä ja mukanasi olevat olette turvallisesti asettuneet arkkiin, lausu silloin: »Kaikki ylistys kuuluu Jumalalle, joka on pelastanut meidät jumalattomien ihmisten seasta.
null.verse 23:29: Ja sano edelleen: »Herrani, suo minulle siunattu ulospääsy, sillä Sinä olet paras turvasatama.
null.verse 23:30: Totisesti nämä ovat tunnusmerkkejä; totisesti Me koettelemme ihmisiä.
null.verse 23:31: Heidän jälkeensä me loimme uuden sukupolven.
null.verse 23:32: Sitten lähetimme heidän luokseen sananjulistajan heidän keskuudestaan, ja hän lausui: »Palvelkaa Jumalaa, teillä ei ole muuta jumalaa kuin Hän.
null.verse 23:33: Mutta päämiehet hänen kansansa keskuudessa, jotka olivat epäuskoisia ja kielsivät tulevan elämän ja joille olimme antanut hyvinvointia tässä maailmassa, lausuivat: »Hän on vain kuolevainen kuten tekin, hän syö mitä tekin syötte ja juo mitä te juotte.
null.verse 23:34: Jos tottelette kaltaistanne ihmistä, menette totisesti turmioon.
null.verse 23:35: Lupaako hän teille, että kun olette kuolleet; ja muuttuneet tomuksi ja luiksi, niin teidät herätetään jälleen eloon?
null.verse 23:36: Se on mahdotonta, aivan mahdotonta, mitä teille on luvattu.
null.verse 23:37: On olemassa ainoastaan tämän maailman elämä, me kuolemme ja me elämme, eikä meitä herätetä kuolleista.
null.verse 23:38: Hän on vain ihminen, joka on sepittänyt valhetta Jumalaa vastaan, emmekä ota häntä uskoaksemme.
null.verse 23:39: Hän sanoi: »Herrani, auta minua, koska he leimaavat minut valhettelijaksi.
null.verse 23:40: Jumala vastasi: »Tuokion kuluttua he totisesti katuvat.
null.verse 23:41: Niin rangaistus yllätti heidät totuuden voimalla, ja Me huuhdoimme heidät kuin roskajätteet.
null.verse 23:42: Sitten Me nostimme heidän jälkeensä uuden sukupolven.
null.verse 23:43: Yksikään kansa ei voi jouduttaa aikansa tuloa eikä sitä siirtää.
null.verse 23:44: Sitten lähetimme sananjulistajia toisen toisensa jälkeen, mutta kun kansa sai lähettilään luokseen, se kielsi hänet, jolloin Me annoimme kansan seurata toistaan ja teimme ne pelkiksi taruiksi.
null.verse 23:45: Senjälkeen lähetimme Mooseksen ja hänen veljensä Aaronin mukanaan merkkimme ja selvät valtuudet
null.verse 23:46: faraon ja hänen päämiestensä luokse, mutta nämä paisuivat ylpeydestään ja olivat julkeita ihmisiä.
null.verse 23:47: Näin he sanoivat: »Uskoisimmeko kahta meidän kaltaistamme ihmistä, joiden kansalaiset ovat meidän orjiamme?»
null.verse 23:48: Näin he kielsivät lähettiläät ja joutuivat niiden joukkoon, jotka kadotettiin.
null.verse 23:49: Totisesti, Me annoimme Moosekselle Kirjan, jotta he saisivat johdatuksen.
null.verse 23:50: Me asetimme myös Marian pojan ja hänen äitinsä tunnusmerkiksi ja annoimme heille suojaa eräällä ylängöllä, jossa oli sopiva lepopaikka ja kirkas lähde.
null.verse 23:51: Te, jotka olette lähettiläitä, syökää puhdasta ravintoa ja suorittakaa hyviä tekoja.
null.verse 23:52: Teidän seurakuntanne on ainoa uskovaisten seurakunta, ja Minä olen teidän Herranne, siksi palvelkaa Minua,
null.verse 23:53: Mutta he ovat hajaantuneet uskonnossaan lahkoiksi, ja jokainen ylvästelee omastaan.
null.verse 23:54: Anna siis heidän joksikin aikaa sokaistua harhaansa.
null.verse 23:55: Luulevatko he, että antaessamme heille rikkautta ja lapsia
null.verse 23:56: joudutamme heille myös hyveitä.
null.verse 23:57: Totisesti, ne, jotka Herransa pelosta ovat vaarinottavaisia,
null.verse 23:58: jotka uskovat Herransa ilmoituksiin,
null.verse 23:59: jotka eivät palvele ketään Jumalan vertaisena
null.verse 23:60: ja jotka antavat antinsa väräjävin sydämin, tietäen palaavansa Herransa luokse,
null.verse 23:61: kaikki nämä ovat niitä, jotka kilpailevat hyveissä ja ensimmäisinä ne saavuttavat.
null.verse 23:62: Emme pane yhdellekään sielulle kuormaa, jota se ei kykenisi kantamaan, ja Meillä on myöskin Kirja, joka puhuu totuutta, joten heille ei tehdä vääryyttä.
null.verse 23:63: Heidän sydämensä ovat vaipuneet tietämättömyyteen tästä Kirjasta, ja sitäpaitsi he suorittavat muitakin tekoja.
null.verse 23:64: Kunnes Me langetamme tuomiomme yltäkylläisesti eläville heidän keskuudessaan, ja katso, silloin he alkavat huutaa.
null.verse 23:65: Älkää huutako apua tänä päivänä; totisesti ette ole saavat sitä Meitä vastaan.
null.verse 23:66: Totisesti, Minun ilmoitukseni julistettiin teille, mutta te käännyitte selin.
null.verse 23:67: Ylvästellen te vetäydytte etäälle.
null.verse 23:68: Eivätkö he siis ole harkinneet, mitä ovat sanoneet? Vai onko heille sattunut sellaista, mitä ei heidän esi-isillensäkään ole sattunut?
null.verse 23:69: Tai eivätkö he tunne sananjulistajaansa ja siksi hänet kieltävät?
null.verse 23:70: Tai sanovatko, että hänet on vallannut hulluus? Ei, hän on tuonut heille totuuden, mutta useimmat heistä ovat totuutta vastaan.
null.verse 23:71: Jos totuus olisi mukautunut heidän himoihinsa, niin varmasti taivaat ja maa ja kaikki, mitä niissä on, olisivat sortuneet raunioiksi.
null.verse 23:72: Vai onko niin, että sinä, oi Muhammed, olet pyytänyt heiltä palkkiota? Mutta onhan Herrasi palkinto paras, sillä Hän on paras huoltaja.
null.verse 23:73: Totisesti, sinä kutsut heitä oikealle tielle.
null.verse 23:74: Mutta totisesti, ne, jotka eivät usko tulevaan elämään, eksyvät tieltä.
null.verse 23:75: Ja vaikkapa Me osoittaisimme heille armoa ja poistaisimme heitä ahdistavan vaivan, niin totisesti, he pysyisivät kurittomuudessaan ja sokeasti jatkaisivat vaellustaan.
null.verse 23:76: Olemme jo yllättänyt heidät rangaistuksella, mutta he eivät nöyryyttäneet sydämiänsä Herransa edessä eivätkä myöskään katuneet.
null.verse 23:77: Mutta kun avaamme heille oven suureen tuskaan, niin katso, silloin he joutuvat epätoivoon.
null.verse 23:78: Jumalahan on antanut teille kuulon ja näön ja sydämen.
null.verse 23:79: Hän on levittänyt teidät yli maan, ja Hänen luokseen teidät jälleen kootaan.
null.verse 23:80: Hän antaa elämän ja kuoleman, ja Hänestä riippuu yön ja päivän vuorottelu.
null.verse 23:81: Päinvastoin, he puhuvat aivan kuten heidän edeltäjänsäkin.
null.verse 23:82: He sanovat: »Kuinka, kun olemme kuolleet ja muuttuneet tomuksi ja luiksi, herätetäänkö meidät silloin taas eloon?
null.verse 23:83: Totisesti, meille on jo aikaisemmin luvattu samaa, kuten muinaisille esi-isillemmekin; nämä ovat pelkkiä muinaistaruja.
null.verse 23:84: Sano: »Kenelle kuuluu maa ja kaikki, mitä siinä on, vastatkaa, jos tiedätte?»
null.verse 23:85: He vastaavat nyt: »Jumalalle.
null.verse 23:86: Sano edelleen: »Kuka on seitsemän taivaan ja suurimman vallan Herra?»
null.verse 23:87: He vastaavat taas: »Jumalalle kuuluu kaikki tämä.
null.verse 23:88: Sano vielä: »Kenen kädessä on kaiken valtius ja kuka antaa suojaa, vaikka häntä vastaan ei ole mitään suojaa, sanokaa, jos tiedätte.
null.verse 23:89: He vastaavat taas: »Tämä kuuluu Jumalalle.
null.verse 23:90: Olemme tuonut heille totuuden, mutta useimmat heistä ovat totisesti valehtelijoita.
null.verse 23:91: Jumala ei konsanaan ole hankkinut itselleen poikaa, eikä ole muuta jumalaa kuin Hän.
null.verse 23:92: Hän tuntee sekä kätketyt että julkiset asiat.
null.verse 23:93: Sano: »Herra, jos näytät minulle, mikä heitä uhkaa,
null.verse 23:94: niin Herra, älä sijoita minua väärämielisten joukkoon.
null.verse 23:95: Totisesti, Me kykenemme näyttämään sinulle, millä Me heitä uhkaamme.
null.verse 23:96: Torju paha sillä, mikä hyvää on.
null.verse 23:97: Sano myös: »Herra.
null.verse 23:98: Sinusta etsin suojaa, oi Herra, etteivät he minua saavuttaisi.
null.verse 23:99: Aina siihen asti, kunnes kuolema jonkun heistä yllättää ja hän hokee: »Herrani, päästä minut takaisin, päästä minut takaisin,
null.verse 23:100: ehkä voisin tehdä hyvää sellaisessa, minkä olen jättänyt tekemättä.
null.verse 23:101: Mutta kun pasuunoihin puhalletaan, niin sinä päivänä heidän välillään ei ole oleva mitään sukulaisuussiteitä, eivätkä he kysele toinen toistansa.
null.verse 23:102: Senvuoksi ne, joiden hyveet painavat vaa'assa eniten, tulevat onnellisiksi.
null.verse 23:103: Mutta joiden ansiot painavat vähän, he ovat niitä, jotka ovat kadottaneet sielunsa.
null.verse 23:104: Tuli on siellä kärventävä heidän kasvonsa ja pahasti turmeleva heidät.
null.verse 23:105: Eikö Minun ilmoituksiani julistettu teille? Mutta te hyljitte niitä.
null.verse 23:106: He vastaavat: »Herra, meidän onnettomuutemme kävivät yli voimiemme ja me olimme harhaan johdettuja ihmisiä.
null.verse 23:107: Herra, päästä meidät pois täältä.
null.verse 23:108: Jumala on vastaava: »Menkää tiehenne älkääkä puhuko Minulle!
null.verse 23:109: Olihan totisesti keskuudessanne ryhmä palvelijoitani, jotka lausuivat: 'Herra, me uskomme, anna meille anteeksi ja osoita meille armoasi, sillä Sinä olet paras armahtaja.
null.verse 23:110: Mutta te piditte heitä pilkkananne, kunnes se sai teidät unohtamaan Minun varoitukseni, ja te nauroitte heitä.
null.verse 23:111: Totisesti Minä tänä päivänä olen heidät palkitseva siitä, että he olivat lujia; he ovat voiton perijöitä.
null.verse 23:112: Vielä kysyy Hän: »Kuinka monta vuotta viivyitte maan päällä?»
null.verse 23:113: He vastaavat: »Viivyimme kai päivän tai osan siitä.
null.verse 23:114: Hän on sanova: »Olette viipyneet vain lyhyen hetken; jospa sen tietäisitte.
null.verse 23:115: Luulitteko, että olimme luonut teidät turhan vuoksi ja ettei teidän ollut palattava Meidän luoksemme?»
null.verse 23:116: Korkea on Jumala, totuuden kuningas; ei ole muuta jumalaa kuin Hän, ylevän voiman Herra.
null.verse 23:117: Ken rukoilee jotakin muuta jumalaa Herran ohella, hänen osaksensa ei tule valoa, ja hänen on tili tehtävä Jumalalle.
null.verse 23:118: Sano: »Herra! Anna anteeksi ja osoita armoasi, sillä Sinä olet paras armahtajista.

Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:2: Ceux qui font acte d'humilité dans leurs prières,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:3: ceux qui évitent les vains propos,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:5: ceux qui se gardent d'avoir des rapports sexuels, sauf
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:6: avec leurs épouses et leurs concubines ; on ne peut alors les blâmer,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:7: tandis que ceux qui convoitent d'autres femmes que celles-là sont des transgresseurs ;
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:8: ceux qui respectent les dépôts à eux confiés, ainsi que leurs engagements,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:9: ceux qui s'acquittent régulièrement de leurs prières,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:11: ils hériteront du Paradis, où ils demeureront à jamais.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:12: Nous avons créé l'homme d'une poignée d'argile,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:13: puis Nous en avons fait une goutte de sperme placée dans un réceptacle solide ;
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:14: puis, de cette goutte, Nous avons créé un caillot de sang ; Nous avons ensuite créé du caillot une masse grumeleuse ; puis de cette masse Nous avons créé des os ; Nous avons alors revêtu les os de chair.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:15: Par la suite, certes, vous mourrez,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:16: et vous serez ressuscités au Jour de la Résurrection.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:17: Nous avons créé au-dessus de vous sept voies (célestes) et Nous ne sommes pas restés indifférents à la création.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:18: Nous avons fait descendre du ciel, avec mesure, une eau que Nous avons mise au repos sous la terre alors qu'il eût été en Notre pouvoir de la laisser se perdre.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:19: Par elle, Nous avons fait croître pour vous des jardins de palmiers et de vignes dans lesquels vous trouvez en abondance les fruits que vous mangez,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:20: ainsi qu'un arbre (l'olivier) qui pousse au Mont Sinaï et qui produit de l'huile et un condiment.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:21: Assurément, il y a dans les troupeaux une leçon pour vous : Nous vous abreuvons de ce qui se trouve dans leur ventre, vous en tirez de nombreux services, et vous mangez de leur chair ;
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:22: vous êtes transportés sur eux comme vous l'êtes sur le navire.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:23: Nous avons envoyé Noé à son peuple.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:24: Ceux des notables de son peuple qui mécroyaient dirent : " Qui donc est celui-ci, sinon un mortel comme vous ? Il veut s'élever au-dessus de vous, alors que si Dieu l'avait voulu, Il aurait fait descendre des anges.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:25: Il n'est qu'un homme possédé par les djinns.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:26: Il dit : " Mon Seigneur ! Prête-moi assistance contre leurs mensonges ! "
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:27: Nous lui avons alors révélé : " Construis un vaisseau sous Nos yeux et selon ce que Nous te révélons.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:28: Lorsque tu seras installé dans le vaisseau, toi et ceux qui sont avec toi, dis : " Louange à Dieu qui nous a sauvés du peuple inique !"
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:29: Et dis : " Mon Seigneur ! Fais-moi parvenir à un lieu béni ! Tu es le meilleur de ceux qui conduisent à bon port ! ""
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:30: Il y a vraiment là des signes, et c'est Nous qui mettons à l'épreuve.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:31: Plus tard, Nous avons suscité après eux d'autres générations
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:32: auxquelles Nous avons envoyé un messager pris parmi eux : " Adorez Dieu ! Il n'y a, pour vous, d'autre dieu que Lui ! N'éprouvez-vous donc aucune crainte ? "
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:33: Les notables de son peuple qui mécroyaient et niaient la rencontre de la vie future, et que Nous avions traités avec largesse dans la vie de ce monde, dirent : " Celui-ci n'est rien d'autre qu'un simple mortel comme vous ; il mange de ce vous mangez et boit de ce que vous buvez.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:34: Or, si vous obéissez à un simple mortel comme vous, vous serez certainement parmi les perdants.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:35: Vous promet-il qu'une fois morts, lorsque vous serez poussière et ossements, on vous fera resurgir ?
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:36: Foin, foin des promesses qui vous sont faites !
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:37: Seule existe notre vie en ce monde : nous mourons, et nous vivons, et nous ne serons pas ressuscités !
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:38: Celui-ci n'est qu'un homme : il a inventé un mensonge contre Dieu et nous ne croyons pas en lui ! "
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:39: Il dit : " Mon Seigneur ! Prête-moi assistance contre leurs mensonges ! "
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:40: Dieu dit : " Sous peu ils éprouveront des regrets ".
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:41: Le cri les a alors saisis pour de vrai, et Nous en avons fait des débris.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:42: Après eux Nous avons créé d'autres générations.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:43: Nulle communauté ne peut avancer son terme ni le reculer.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:44: Nous fîmes ensuite se succéder Nos envoyés.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:45: Puis Nous avons envoyé Moïse et son frère Aaron, nantis de Nos signes et d'un pouvoir manifeste,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:46: à Pharaon et à ses notables ; mais ceux-ci se sont montrés orgueilleux et pleins d'arrogance.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:47: Ils dirent : " Allons-nous ajouter foi à deux mortels semblables à nous et dont le peuple nous est asservi ? "
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:48: Ils les traitèrent tous deux de menteurs, mais ils furent anéantis.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:49: Nous avons donné à Moïse le Livre pour qu'ils puissent être bien dirigés.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:50: Nous avons fait du fils de Marie et de sa mère un signe.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:51: O vous, les Envoyés ! Mangez des bonnes nourritures et agissez vertueusement ! Je sais parfaitement ce que vous faites.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:52: Cette communauté, la vôtre, est vraiment une seule et même communauté, et Moi, Je suis votre Seigneur ! Craignez-Moi donc !
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:53: Mais les hommes se sont divisés en sectes, chaque faction se réjouissant de ce qu'elle détenait.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:54: Laisse-les donc pour un temps dans leur confusion.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:55: Pensent-ils que les biens et les enfants dont Nous les gratifions
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:56: sont un encouragement pressant à pratiquer le bien ? Non, ils n'en ont pas conscience.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:57: Certes, ceux qui sont pénétrés de la crainte de leur Seigneur,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:58: ceux qui croient aux signes de leur Seigneur.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:59: Ceux qui n'associent rien à leur Seigneur,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:60: Ceux qui donnent ce qu'ils donnent tandis que leurs cœurs frémissent à la pensée de retourner vers leur Seigneur :
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:61: ceux-là se hâtent vers les bonnes actions et sont les premiers à les accomplir.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:62: Nous ne chargeons une âme que selon sa capacité.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:63: Pourtant leurs cœurs restent à cet égard dans une profonde confusion, et ils ont d'autres occupations auxquelles ils se consacrent,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:64: jusqu'au moment où Nous viendrons châtier ceux d'entre eux qui sont prospères et où ils se mettront à crier.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:65: Ne criez pas, aujourd'hui, car vous ne serez pas secourus contre Nous.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:66: Mes versets vous étaient bien récités, mais vous leur tourniez résolument les talons,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:67: enflés d'orgueil et passant la nuit à les dénigrer.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:68: Ne prêtent-ils pas attention à la Parole ? N'ont-ils pas reçu ce qui n'avait pas été accordé à leurs ancêtres les plus lointains ?
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:69: Ne reconnaissent-ils pas leur Envoyé au point de le renier ?
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:70: Diront-ils qu'il est possédé par des djinns ? Rien de cela ! Il est venu à eux avec la Vérité, mais la plupart d'entre eux méprisent la Vérité.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:71: Si la Vérité se pliait à leurs passions, les cieux, la terre et tout ce qui s'y trouve sombreraient dans la corruption.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:72: Craignent-ils que tu leur demandes de te rétribuer ? Mais la rétribution venant de ton Seigneur est meilleure, car Il est le meilleur des dispensateurs.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:73: Certes, tu les appelles vers une voie droite,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:74: mais ceux qui ne croient pas à la vie dernière s'écartent de cette voie.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:75: Même si Nous leur faisions miséricorde et si Nous les délivrions du mal qui les afflige, ils continueraient à marcher aveuglément dans leur rébellion.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:76: Nous les avons déjà saisis par le châtiment, mais ils ne se sont pas remis à leur Seigneur et n'ont montré aucune humilité.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:77: Il faudra que Nous leur ouvrions une porte donnant sur un châtiment rigoureux.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:78: C'est Lui qui a créé pour vous l'ouïe, la vue et les cœurs.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:79: C'est Lui qui vous a répandus sur la terre, et c'est vers Lui que vous serez rassemblés.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:80: C'est Lui qui fait vivre et qui fait mourir, et c'est à Lui qu'appartient la succession de la nuit et du jour.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:81: Au contraire, ils parlent comme parlaient les Anciens,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:82: disant : " Voyons ! Lorsque nous serons morts, que nous serons poussière et ossements, se peut-il que nous ressuscitions ?
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:83: Déjà, nous et nos pères avions jadis reçu cette promesse, mais ce ne sont là qu'affabulations d'Anciens ! "
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:84: Dis : " A qui donc appartiennent la terre et ceux qui s'y trouvent ?
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:86: Ils répondront : " A Dieu ! " Dis-leur : " Pourquoi, alors, ne vous souvenez-vous pas ? ".
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:87: Dis : " Qui est le Seigneur des sept cieux et le Seigneur du Trône immense ? "
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:88: Ils diront : " C'est Dieu ! " Dis leur : " Pourquoi, alors, ne craignez-vous
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:90: Dis : " Qui tient en Sa main la Royauté de toute chose, et protège sans qu'on Le protège ?
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:92: Ils répondront : " C'est Dieu ! " Dis : " Alors, [pour ne pas croire]vous devez être ensorcelés ! "
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:93: Nous leur avons apporté la Vérité, mais ce sont des menteurs.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:94: Dieu n'a pas pris de fils, et il n'y a pas de divinité avec Lui.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:95: Il connaît l'Invisible et le visible ; Il est bien au-dessus de ce qu'ils Lui associent.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:96: Dis : " Mon Seigneur ! Si Tu me montrais ce qui leur est promis.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:97: mon Seigneur, ne me place pas parmi les iniques ! "
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:98: Certes, Nous avons le pouvoir de te montrer ce que Nous leur promettons.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:99: Repousse le mal par ce qui est meilleur.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:100: Dis : " Mon Seigneur ! Je prends refuge en Toi contre les séductions des démons ! "
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:101: Je prends refuge en Toi, mon Seigneur, pour qu'ils ne se présentent pas à moi ! "
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:102: Lorsque la mort vient visiter l'un d'eux, il s'écrie : " Mon Seigneur, que l'on me fasse revenir !
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:103: Peut-être accomplirai-je le bien que j'ai négligé ".
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:104: Ce jour-là, lorsque retentira la trompette, il n'y aura plus entre eux de filiation et ils ne se questionneront plus les uns les autres.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:105: Ceux dont les œuvres pèseront lourd, ceux-là seront les bienheureux,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:106: et ceux dont la balance sera légère, ceux-là se seront eux-mêmes perdus et demeureront à jamais dans la Géhenne.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:107: Le feu consumera leur visage assombri par la douleur.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:108: Ne vous a-t-on pas communiqué Mes signes et ne les avez-vous pas traités de mensonges ?
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:109: Ils diront : " Notre Seigneur, notre misère nous a vaincus et nous étions égarés !
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:110: Notre Seigneur, sors-nous de la Géhenne, et si nous récidivons nous serons vraiment iniques ! "
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:111: " Restez-y, dira Dieu, et ne me parlez plus ! "
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:112: Il y avait un groupe de Mes serviteurs qui disaient : " Notre Seigneur, nous croyons ! Pardonne-nous ! Fais-nous miséricorde ! Tu es le meilleur des miséricordieux ! "
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:113: Mais vous les avez pris pour objet de vos railleries, oubliant de vous souvenir de Moi tant vous étiez occupés à rire.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:114: Certes, aujourd'hui, Je les récompense pour leur patience et ils sont heureux.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:115: Dieu dira : " Combien d'années êtes-vous restés sur la terre ? "
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:116: Ils répondront : " Nous y sommes restés un jour, ou partie d'un jour ; interroge donc ceux qui font le comput ! "
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:117: Dieu dira : " Vous n'êtes restés que peu de temps ; ah, si vous pouviez savoir !
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:118: Pensiez-vous que Nous vous aurions créés sans but et que vous ne seriez pas ramenés vers Nous ? "
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:119: Que Dieu soit exalté, le Roi, la Vérité ! Il n'y a de dieu que Lui, le Seigneur du noble Trône !
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:120: Quiconque implore avec Dieu une autre divinité dont l'existence ne lui est aucunement prouvée devra en rendre compte à son Seigneur.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 23:121: Dis : " Mon Seigneur, pardonne et fais miséricorde ! Tu es le meilleur des miséricordieux ! "

Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:2: ceux qui sont humbles dans leur Salat,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:5: et qui préservent leurs sexes [de tout rapport],
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:6: si ce n’est qu’avec leurs épouses ou les esclaves qu’ils possèdent , car là vraiment, on ne peut les blâmer;
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:7: alors que ceux qui cherchent au-delà de ces limites sont des transgresseurs;
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:8: et qui veillent à la sauvegarde des dépôts confiés à eux et honorent leurs engagements,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:9: et qui observent strictement leur Salat.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:11: qui hériteront le Paradis pour y demeurer éternellement.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:12: Nous avons certes créé l’homme d’un extrait d’argile,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:13: puis Nous en fîmes une goutte de sperme dans un reposoir solide.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:14: Ensuite, Nous avons fait du sperme une adhérence; et de l’adhérence Nous avons créé un embryon; puis, de cet embryon Nous avons créé des os et Nous avons revêtu les os de chair.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:15: Et puis, après cela vous mourrez.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:16: Et puis au Jour de la Résurrection vous serez ressuscités.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:17: Nous avons créé, au-dessus de vous, sept cieux.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:18: Et Nous avons fait descendre l’eau du ciel avec mesure.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:19: Avec elle, Nous avons produit pour vous des jardins de palmiers et de vignes, dans lesquels vous avez des fruits abondants et desquels vous mangez,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:20: ainsi qu’un arbre (l’olivier) qui pousse au Mont Sinai, en produisant l’huile servant à oindre et où les mangeurs trempent leur pain.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:21: Vous avez certes dans les bestiaux, un sujet de méditation : Nous vous donnons à boire de ce qu’ils ont dans le ventre, et vous y trouvez également maintes utilités; et vous vous en nourrissez.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:22: Sur eux ainsi que sur des vaisseaux vous êtes transportés.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:23: Nous envoyâmes Noé vers son peuple.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:25: Alors les notables de son peuple qui avaient mécru dirent : «Celui-ci n’est qu’un être humain comme vous voulant se distinguer à votre détriment.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:26: Ce n’est en vérité qu’un homme atteint de folie, observez-le donc durant quelque temps.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:27: Il dit : «Seigneur ! Apporte-moi secours parce qu’ils me traitent de menteur».
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:28: Nous lui révélâmes : «Construis l’arche sous Nos yeux et selon Notre révélation.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:29: Et lorsque tu seras installé, toi et ceux qui sont avec toi, dans l’arche, dis : «Louange à Dieu qui nous a sauvés du peuple des injustes.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:30: Et dis : «Seigneur, fais-moi débarquer d’un débarquement béni.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:32: Puis, après eux, Nous avons créé d’autres générations,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:33: Nous envoyâmes parmi elles un Messager
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:35: Les notables de son peuple qui avaient mécru et traité de mensonge la rencontre de l’au-delà, et auxquels Nous avions accordé le luxe dans la vie présente, dirent : «Celui-ci n’est qu’un être humain comme vous, mangeant de ce que vous mangez, et buvant de ce que vous buvez.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:36: Si vous obéissez à un homme comme vous, vous serez alors perdants.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:37: Vous promet-il, quand vous serez morts, et devenus poussière et ossements, que vous serez sortis [de vos sépulcres] ?
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:38: Loin, loin, ce qu’on vous promet !
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:39: Ce n’est là que notre vie présente : nous mourons et nous vivons; et nous ne serons jamais ressuscités.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:40: Ce n’est qu’un homme qui forge un mensonge contre Dieu; et nous ne croirons pas en lui».
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:41: Il dit : «Seigneur ! Apporte-moi secours parce qu’ils me traitent de menteur».
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:43: dit : «Oui, bientôt ils en viendront aux regrets».
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:44: Le cri, donc, les saisit en toute justice; puis Nous les rendîmes semblables à des débris emportés par le torrent.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:45: Puis après eux Nous avons créé d’autres générations.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:46: Nulle communauté ne peut avancer ni reculer son terme.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:47: Ensuite, Nous envoyâmes successivement Nos messagers.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:48: Ensuite, Nous envoyâmes Moïse et son frère Aaron avec Nos prodiges et une preuve évidente,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:49: vers Pharaon et ses notables mais ceux-ci s’enflèrent d’orgueil : ils étaient des gens hautains.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:50: Ils dirent : «Croirons-nous en deux hommes comme nous dont les congénères sont nos esclaves.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:51: Ils les traitèrent [tous deux] de menteurs et ils furent donc parmi les anéantis.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:52: Et Nous avions apporté le Livre à Moïse afin qu’ils se guident.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:53: Et Nous fîmes du fils de Marie, ainsi que de sa mère, un prodige; et Nous donnâmes à tous deux asile sur une colline bien stable et dotée d’une source.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:54: ô Messagers ! Mangez de ce qui est permis et agréable et faites du bien.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:55: Cette communauté, la vôtre, est une seule communauté, tandis que Je suis votre Seigneur.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:56: Mais ils se sont divisés en sectes, chaque secte exultant de ce qu’elle détenait.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:57: Laisse-les dans leur égarement pour un certain temps.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:58: Pensent-ils que ce que Nous leur accordons, en biens et en enfants,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:59: [soit une avance] que Nous Nous empressons de leur faire sur les biens [de la vie future] ? Au contraire, ils n’en sont pas conscients.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:60: Ceux qui, de la crainte de leur Seigneur, sont pénétrés,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:61: qui croient aux versets de leur Seigneur,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:62: qui n’associent rien à leur Seigneur,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:63: qui donnent ce qu’ils donnent, tandis que leurs coeurs sont pleins de crainte [à la pensée] qu’ils doivent retourner à leur Seigneur.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:64: Ceux-là se précipitent vers les bonnes actions et sont les premiers à les accomplir.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:65: Nous n’imposons à personne que selon sa capacité.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:66: Mais leurs coeurs restent dans l’ignorance à l’égard de cela [le Coran].
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:67: jusqu’à ce que par le châtiment Nous saisissions les plus aisés parmi eux et voilà qu’ils crient au secours.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:69: Mes versets vous étaient récités auparavant; mais vous vous
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:71: enflant d’orgueil, et vous les dénigriez au cours de vos veillées».
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:72: Ne méditent-ils donc pas sur la parole (le Coran) ? Ou est-ce que leur est venu ce qui n’est jamais venu à leurs premiers ancêtres ?
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:73: Ou n’ont-ils pas connu leur Messager, au point de le renier ?
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:74: Ou diront-ils : «Il est fou ? » Au contraire, c’est la vérité qu’il leur a apportée.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:75: Si la vérité était conforme à leurs passions, les cieux et la terre et ceux qui s’y trouvent seraient, certes, corrompus.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:76: Ou leur demandes-tu une rétribution ? Mais la rétribution de ton Seigneur est meilleure.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:77: Et tu les appelles, certes, vers le droit chemin.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:78: Or, ceux qui ne croient pas à l’au-delà sont bien écartés de ce chemin.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:79: Si Nous leur faisions miséricorde et écartions d’eux le mal, ils persisteraient certainement dans leur transgression, confus et hésitants.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:80: Nous les avons certes saisis du châtiment, mais ils ne se sont pas soumis à leur Seigneur; de même qu’ils ne
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:82: jusqu’au jour où Nous ouvrirons sur eux une porte au dur châtiment, et voilà qu’ils en seront désespérés.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:83: Et c’est Lui qui a créé pour vous l’ouïe, les yeux et les coeurs.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:84: C’est Lui qui vous a répandus sur la terre, et c’est vers Lui que vous serez rassemblés.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:85: Et c’est Lui qui donne la vie et qui donne la mort; et l’alternance de la nuit et du jour dépend de Lui.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:86: Ils ont plutôt tenu les mêmes propos que les anciens.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:87: Ils ont dit : «lorsque nous serons morts et que nous serons poussière et ossements, serons-nous vraiment ressuscités ?
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:88: On nous a promis cela, ainsi qu’à nos ancêtres auparavant; ce ne sont que de vieilles sornettes».
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:89: Dis : «A qui appartient la terre et ceux qui y sont ? si vous savez».
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:91: Dis : «Qui est le Seigneur des sept cieux et le Seigneur du Trône sublime ? »
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:93: Dis : «Qui détient dans sa main la royauté absolue de toute chose, et qui protège et n’a pas besoin d’être protégé ? ,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:96: Nous leur avons plutôt apporté la vérité et ils sont assurément des menteurs.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:97: Dieu ne S’est point attribué d’enfant et il n’existe point de divinité avec Lui; sinon, chaque divinité s’en irait avec ce qu’elle a créés et certaines seraient supérieures aux autres.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:98: [Il est] Connaisseur de toute chose visible et invisible ! Il est bien au-dessus de ce qu’ils
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:100: Dis : «Seigneur, si jamais Tu me montres ce qui leur est promis;
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:101: alors, Seigneur, ne me place pas parmi les gens injustes.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:102: Nous sommes Capable, certes, de te montrer ce que Nous leur promettons.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:103: Repousse le mal par ce qui est meilleur.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:104: Et dis : «Seigneur, je cherche Ta protection, contre les incitations des diables.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:105: et je cherche Ta protection, Seigneur, contre leur présence auprès de moi».
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:107: afin que je fasse du bien dans ce que je délaissais».
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:108: Puis quand on soufflera dans la Trompe, il n’y aura plus de parenté entre eux ce jour là, et ils ne se poseront pas de questions.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 23:109: Ceux dont la balance est lourde seront les bienheureux;
